This will allow her to augment her inventories, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Loreta hopes to improve her business so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries, condiments and others.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Leny works hard to support her family. She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending and a general store business.

Leny is borrowing PHP 24,500 through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

Leny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Rosemalyn

texts.en:
Rosemalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines.

Rosemalyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Rosemalyn has been in this business for ten years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Mon, born in 1986, is a Thai ethnic woman. She lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and animal breeding. Mon is planning to expand their goat breeding business for reproduction and selling goat meat to increase the family’s income. 

Mon's family earns VND 50 million at each harvest but it is just enough to buy food and save a small amount, which is not enough to invest in expanding the goat  breeding business. Mon really wants to borrow a loan to invest in this purpose to improve her family’s living conditions. She hopes that the loan will help her family to invest effectively in this business which will bring her family lovely goats and will somewhat improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her goat breeding business

loans.name: Cheroline

texts.en: Cheroline is widowed and she works hard to support her family. For the past 10 years, she has operated a fish and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Cheroline has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and vegetables to sell to her customers. Cheroline would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more fish and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Harold Joseph

texts.en:
Harold Joseph is 19 years old and from Cabanatuan City. His father is a driver, and what his father earns is just enough to make ends meet. Therefore, sending the children to school is difficult.

That’s why Harold wants to seek PHP 15,000 in financial assistance from the Kiva lenders. He will use this in pursuing a certificate in a mechatronics course.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee.

loans.name: Hòa

texts.en:
Mrs. Hòa operates a food stall/restaurant selling, fish. Hòa is 44 years old, and she is married, with three children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. This is Hòa first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hòa has been involved in her business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hòa faces in her life is the lack of a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick, with which to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hòa hopes to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick, with which to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia is 48 years old, is married and lives in Silanga, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood. The pigs' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement. With a desire to earn more income, Nelia decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam MPC, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional bags of feed for her growing pigs. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to her husband's income. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily maintain more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feed for her growing pigs

loans.name: Santa Isabel

texts.es:
Santa Isabel tiene 45 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material noble, vive con su cónyugue y su hijo de 12 años de edad. Santa Isabel vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú; contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Santa Isabel es a la venta de productos de primera necesidad contando con clientela propia de la zona, asi como su cónyuge se dedica a transporte urbano en su mototaxi. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en compra de mercaderia para surtir, diversificar y aumentar u stock para que su negocio crezca con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Santa Isabel is 45 years old. She and her partner and their 12-year-old son live in their own home, which is made of durable materials and has water and electricity. Santa Isabel lives in a rural part of the district of Pucará, part of the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru. The people of the area are mostly in farming, ranching, and commerce.

Santa Isabel herself earns a living by selling necessary goods to her customer base in the area. Her husband is in the business of urban transportation using his taxi. This loan will be used to supply her store with current merchandise, as well as to diversify and expand her inventory. This will help her business grow, increase her income, and improve her quality of life. In this line of work, there's not much competition in the area and so she can get better prices.

loans.use: buy merchandise to expand and diversify her store's inventory

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 50 years old and married with six children, who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Susana has been in this business for 16 years. She would like to save enough money so that in the future, she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 56 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cristita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cristita has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as soap, diapers, shampoo, and other groceries.

In the future, Cristita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 49 years old and married. She has one child who is currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Angelita has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 46 years old and married with five children.  With two children in school, Editha works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Editha has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Editha would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Anselma has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

In the future, Anselma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Erlita works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig raising and buying and selling fish. Erlita successfully repaid her previous loan and she has now requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to  buy additional fishing nets for her business. 

Erlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong, born in 1979, has been participating in the program since January 1996. She is currently living with her husband and her three daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is livestock breeding and cultivation. Each year, she sells several pigs and a few quintals of coffee. After deducting investment costs, the remaining income is just enough for covering the cost of food with a little amount left. 

However, it is not enough to expand their sow raising model. Therefore, she needs to take out a loan for this purpose. She expects the loan will help her family to invest effectively in this sow raising model, and thanks to that, her family’s life will be improved. 

She will work hard to get the money to repay M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to expand her sow raising model.

loans.name: Santos Ynes

texts.es:
Santos Ynes tiene 49 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su cónyugue y su hijo de 14 años de edad. Santos Ynes vive en la parte rural del distrito distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú; contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Santos Ynes es a la venta de productos de primera necesidad contando con clientela propia de la zona, asi como su cónyuge se dedica a realizar trabajos para la municipalidad de Pucara. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio con ello le generara mayores ingresos. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Ynes, age 49, lives with her partner and 14-year-old son. They have their own home made from simple materials and have running water and electricity. They live in a rural part of the district of Pucará in the Jaén province, part of the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru. The people in the area are principally in the business of farming, ranching, and commerce.

Santos Ynes herself is in the business of selling staple goods to the people in the area, and her husband works for the city of Pucara. This loan will be used to invest in buying merchandise to supply Santos Ynes' store. This will help her generate more income. There is little competition in this type of business locally, which will help her get a better price. In the short term, this loan will increase her income, expand her earnings, and ultimately improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia es estudiante y comenta que con ayuda de su madre está  cubriendo sus estudios para así poder obtener su titulo y poder ejercer  su profesión de profesorado en educación escolar básica.
Su madre es docente, y es uno de los motivos por lo que se decidió seguir esta noble carrera. Su objetivo es terminar su carrera para así poder ayudar a su mama con los gastos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Leticia is a student and says that with the help of her mother, she is able to cover her studies. As a result, she will be able to obtain her degree and pursue a profession as a physical education teacher.

Her mother is also a teacher, which is one of the reasons why she decided to pursue this noble career. Her goal is to finish her degree so that she can help her mother with the expenses.

Leticia is requesting this loan so that she can pay her university fees. This will enable her to continue her studies as before.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is a merchant from Dulag, Leyte. He sells household materials like kitchen ware, dry goods and hardware materials. He has a stall situated inside the market and displays his stock. He is married and has four children. His oldest child is 10 and the youngest is 1 year old. Avelino has been engaged in this kind of business for six years already.

Avelino has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP  to purchase various dry goods like plastic ware and hardware tools. With these, he could sell a variety of stock and attract more customers. 
 
In the future, Avelino is hoping that he could expand his business and provide the needs of his growing children.

loans.use: to purchase various dry goods like plastic ware and hardware tools.

loans.name: Cintya Aymee

texts.es:
Cintya Aymee tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente, con un hijo a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Cintya Aymee se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral(patos, pollos, etc.), desde hace 4 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; compra de chivos, patos, gallina, pavos. El préstamo le ayudara para tener una mayor inversión, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cintya Aymee is 28 years old and lives with her partner and one dependent child. They live in a family home in a rural area in the district of Oyotún, part of the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region along the northern coast of Peru. Most of the people in the area are in the business of farming, cattle ranching, or commerce.

Cintya Aymee herself earns a living by raising and selling pen animals (ducks, chickens, etc). She's been doing this for four years and she runs her business out of her home. She is requesting this loan to increase her working capital and buy kid goats, ducks, hens, and turkeys. The loan will help her have a greater investment with the end goal of expanding her business and meeting the needs of her customers. In the short term, this means an increase of income, greater earnings, and ultimately improved quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: buy kid goats, ducks, hens, and turkeys

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with six children. She is 46 years old and two of her children are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gemma has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Gemma has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so that in the future, she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 42 years old and has four children. She is married and one of her children is currently in school.

Catherine is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in her pig fattening business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Catherine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Helen works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and pig fattening.  

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Helen is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Quy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quy, born in 1977, is a Thai ethnic woman. She lives with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her meager salary and her husband’s wage from construction work. Therefore, she wants to invest in the expansion of pig raising for meat to improve her family’s living conditions.

She hopes to access the loan to develop a pig-raising model for meat, helping the family with a higher income so that their lives will be less difficult.

loans.use: to develop a pig-raising model for meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood and zinc sheets so that he can improve the roof of his house.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a merchant from Leyte, Philippines. She is 26 years old, married and has two children.  Cristina has operated her sari-sari (variety) store for more than three years now. This is her source of income.
 
Cristina is asking to take out a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, such as soap and detergents, shampoo and toiletries, soda, coffee, sugar, canned good and noodles, rice, biscuits and snack foods. 

This loan will allow her to improve her stock and attract more buyers to her store. Cristina has hopes of improving her livelihood in the future. She also wants to save some extra money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as soap and detergents, shampoo and toiletries, soda, coffee, sugar, canned goods and noodles, rice, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Savi

texts.en:
Savi, 21 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has one little child. He is in the military and earns a daily salary of around USD 10.00 on average. His wife, Sao, is a farmer who grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, she can make an income of USD 2.00 per day.

Savi would to apply for a Kiva loan via HKL, and he is going to use this loan to buy a motorbike. He hopes that the support from this loan can help to promote his living standard. He would like to thank all lenders for their financial support of poor people.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who does business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell in her business.

Vilma has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains for her business

loans.name: Florisita

texts.en:
Florisita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 40 years old and a married woman with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 21 years. 

Helen requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lerma works hard to support her family.

Lerma has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lerma is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her ice cream vending business such as sugar, milk, ice cubes, etc.

Lerma successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lerma has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients such as sugar, milk, ice cubes, etc

loans.name: Bac's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Bac, born in 1977, is a Kinh woman. She lives with her husband and her three children (two daughters and one son) in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupations are fresh vegetable growing and animal breeding. Of her three children, one is at kindergarten, one in junior high school, and the eldest daughter is going to finish senior high school this year. 

Therefore, Mrs Bac needs to take out a loan to invest in her children’s education. She expects that the loan amount will help her children complete all of their academic programs, and that they will have stable jobs in the future.

loans.use: to borrow a loan to invest in her children’s education

loans.name: Eresmilda

texts.es:
Eresmilda está estudiando para tener mejores condiciones de vida y así salir adelante económicamente y ser una profesional, ella está estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en matemáticas y comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar sus cuotas, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Eresmilda is studying to have better living conditions, to succeed financially and to become a professional.  She is studying a degree in mathematics.  She comments that she used her previous loan to pay her fees, which was very helpful.

Today she is asking for this loan to be able to pay the university fees again and this way continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma has been earning from her farm to make a living. She earns better income that provides for the needs of the family. She had repaid successfully her previous loan used for farming. Aside from this, she was also engaged in a sewing business to make an extra income aside from farming. She borrowed a new loan to buy fabrics for making pillow cases, curtains and children's wear to sell. In future, she plans to buy another sewing machine for expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for making pillow cases, curtains and children's wear to sell.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is a married woman with one child. Ginalyn is 35 years old and has one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ginalyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ginalyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Ginalyn has been in this business for ten years. Ginalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hermogina

texts.en:
Hermogina is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hermogina is 53 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Hermogina has a shoe repair business in the Philippines. Hermogina requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Hermogina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Hermogina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her shoe repair business.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca 

Rebeca es madre de 2 hijos, trabajadora y emprendedora, después de su separación y con el apoyo de sus padres inicia el negocio de venta de ropa, al residir cerca del colegio ofrece el servicio de bazar y librería el cual mantiene un buen nivel de ventas está interesada en fortalecer, con este préstamo, la ropa de temporada, para el verano 2015.

Su empeño la ha llevado a tener una actividad consolidada que le ha ayudado a atender a sus hijos. Antes se dedicaba a trabajar fuera de la casa, pero para estar cerca de ellos decidió implementar este negocio. Desea obtener mejores ganancias al comprar ella misma los productos. Contribuye también a los gastos de su casa. Tiene cerca de 12 años de experiencia en el comercio, desea ahorrar para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Inició con la liquidación de un trabajo, hace cerca de 4 años, ha contado con el apoyo de sus padres y su abuela. Ha reinvertido  y conseguido diversificar sus productos, ofreciendo ropa, zapatos, productos de bazar y para estudiantes, además vende choco bananos.

Mantiene una clientela fija de cerca de 54 personas a crédito;  además vende de contado y ofrece productos de moda. Se cuenta con un local propio, establecido en el corredor de la casa de sus padres, la tienda bazar está ubicada detrás del colegio de chacarita, por lo que vende a estudiantes productos de comida (choco Bananos) además de ofrecer productos escolares y de bisutería. Vende ropa que le confecciona una amiga (generando empleo) y desea comercializar directamente su mercadería, la cual ella compra; teniendo un buen margen de ganancia. Clientela  estable, que le permite invertir en mercadería de temporada.
texts.en:
Rebeca is the mother of two children. She is a hard worker and an entrepreneur. After she separated, and with the support of her parents, she launched a clothing business. She used to work outside of the home, but in order to be close to her kids she decided to start this business. 

Through hard work, Rebeca has been able to establish this business which enables her to provide for her children. She hopes to increase her earnings by making the purchases herself. She also contributes to household expenditures. She has around 12 years of experience in business. She hopes to save so that she can give her children a better future. She has been able to count on the support of her parents and her grandmother, and on severance pay she got from a job about 4 years ago. She reinvested that money and diversified her products so she now sells clothing, shoes, home wares and school supplies. She even sells chocolate-dipped bananas.

Living close to the high school, Rebeca runs a general store and book store which has a good volume of sales. She has her own shop, situated in the hallway of her parent's house. Then, the school store located behind the Chacarita school, from which she sells school supplies, jewelry and food products such as chocolate-dipped bananas.

Rebeca has nearly 54 regular clients, who shop on credit. She also makes cash sales and offers fashion products. She is interested in further bolstering her sales through this loan by stocking seasonal clothing for the summer of 2015. The clothing Rebeca sells is made by one of her friends, this generates employment for her friend. The clothing she buys she wants to sell directly because it will improve her margins. Thanks to stable clientele Rebeca can invest in seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing styles for her store.

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
Osvaldo esta estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería en informática, es una persona que se esta esforzando por ser alguien en la vida.
Esta esforzándose por ser un profesional útil a las demás personas y a la sociedad, su familia es quien la inspira a poder salir adelante.
pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y de esa forma seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Osvaldo is studying for a degree in IT engineering, and he is working hard to become someone in life. 

He is working hard to become a professional who will be helpful to others and to Society, and his family provides him with the inspiration that enables him to move forward.

He is requesting this loan in order to pay the program fees, and thus continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is grateful for the financial assistance extended to her. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. The loan also helped in the education of her children.

Benita is requesting another 15,000 PHP loan to buy mung beans for her repacking business. She will also use the new loan to pay for the maintenance of her house for rent. The resulting increase in profits will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Benita dreams of growing and expanding her business and hopes that her youngest child will finish his architectural degree. She meets up with her fellowship group* every week to share stories of her life and business and to gain strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy mung beans to repack and resell, and to pay for the maintenance of her rental house.

loans.name: Karem

texts.es:
Karem es la mayor de 2 Hermanos, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de lambaré. Ella estudia en una importante universidad la carrera de arquitectura.
Ella sueña con ser una excelente arquitecta y poder dar una ayuda a su familia que tanto la han apoyado, y también poder dar un buen servicio a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matriculación a la carrera y también para la compra de libros.
texts.en:
Karem is the oldest of two siblings. She lives with her parents in the city of Lambaré. She is studying for a degree in Architecture at a major university.

Karem dreams of being a successful architect and helping her family by providing them support. She will also be offering a good service to society.

Karem is requesting this loan so that she can pay for her degree tuition and also buy books.

loans.use: to pay her degree tuition and to buy books.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 61 years old and married with ten children.

Luzviminda earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Luzviminda has been pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from farming rice and running a general store.

Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Luzviminda is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and sell-vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from boarding house rental. Rowena is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jesucia

texts.en:
Jesucia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jesucia is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Jesucia has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. Jesucia requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials like nail polish, nail nipper, etc. for her business.

Jesucia has been in this business for 20 years. Jesucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like nail polish, nail nipper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos de 48 años de edad, está casado y tiene 5 hijos de 23, 22, 19, 14 y 13 años de edad solo dos de ellos estudian, él solo estudio hasta hasta primer grado de educación básica, su esposa es ama de casa, ella, tres hijos, una nuera y una sobrina viven con él.

Carlos es agricultor desde que tenía 12 años, aprendió con su papá que desde pequeño lo llevaba al campo a trabajar y aprendiera el oficio, también tiene dos años de dedicarse al comercio de ganado y como familia tienen 7 años de administrar una pequeña tienda.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar granos básicos, productos de cocina e higiene personal, golosinas y bebidas para su tienda y abastecer el inventario, ya que cerca de su casa hoy un molino y cuando las personas llegan a moler la mayoría pasa comprando en su tienda y quiere mantener la estabilidad del negocio. Carlos sueña con que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, por el momento 3 son bachilleres pero espera que logre terminar la universidad.
texts.en:
Carlos is 48 years old. He is married and has five children who are 23, 22, 19, 14 and 13 years old. Only two of them are still in school. Carlos himself only went to school through first grade. His wife is a homemaker, and their household is composed of himself, his wife, three of their children, a daughter-in-law, and a niece.

Carlos has been a farmer for the past twelve years. He learned this business from his father, who brought Carlos out into the field to work and to learn the trade ever since he was a little boy. He has also been in the cattle business for two years, and their family has seven years of experience running a small store.

The loan will be used to purchase basic grains, sodas and other beverages; as well as kitchen products and toiletries. These will stock the merchandise in the store, so that Carlos can maintain the stability of the store. There is a nearby mill, and when people go to the mill, the majority of them stop by the store to purchase items. 

Carlos' dream is that his children will be able to complete their studies - three of them have high school degrees, but he hopes that they will manage to finish university.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, kitchen and toiletry products, and beverages for his store.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Her name is Ramona, and she is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Jessie, a driver, and they have four children. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her children.

Ramona has a direct selling business. She sells clothing, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Natasha, and Boardwalk. Dealers buy the products at lower prices than those shown in the catalog for the customers and sell them at a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family, and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy merchandise items and fill orders for beauty products, ladies’ bags, clothing, and undergarments for her customers. Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods for their good quality. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial help that will be given her.

Ramona aims to grow her business so that she can send her children to the best school possible. She dreams of all of them finishing college and living a quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship group* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for direct selling personal products to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita, who is married, works hard to support her family. For 15 years now, she has operated a used clothing business in the Philippines.

Juanita has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of used clothing to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Bich's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bich, born in 1960, was a lowlander who came to do business in Son La province. She got married in 1984, and her family consists of five members; she, her husband, her eldest daughter and her two sons. Her family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is planting a longan farm and raising pigs for meat. It is hard year-round but it is just enough for covering the family’s living costs and paying for her children’s education costs. She dreams of having a little capital to invest in livestock breeding to improve her family’s living conditions, but she doesn’t have enough capital. Therefore, she now wants to borrow a loan to invest in sow breeding. She expects that the loan will help her invest in expanding the breeding model, and she will work hard to get money to repay M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in sow breeding.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku, a maize farmer, would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more.

Like other Babban Gona members, Isiyaku is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family; he also hopes to ensure his children, Hafizu, Anas and Zaharau, are educated and have access to professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se esta esforzando para poder salir adelante y poder crecer, comenta que por medio de su trabajo está ayudando a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Su anterior préstamo de kiva lo uso en poder comprar productos varios para la venta, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder comprar sobrecamas, frazadas, manteles y sábanas, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Wilson is a very hardworking and enterprising person who strives to be able to get ahead and be able to grow. Through his work he is helping his family and his loved ones. His previous loan from KIva was used to be able to buy different products to sell, and that was a big help to him.  

He is asking for this new loan to be able to buy bedspreads, blankets, tablecloths, sheets, and more. This way, he can continue with his sales as he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, blankets, tablecloths and sheets.

loans.name: Efa

texts.en:
Efa is a 54-year-old lady married to Laazar, who is 60 years old. They are blessed with two children: Getreda, 15, in the 3rd grade of junior high school, and Abdon, 11, in the 6th grade of elementary school. Efa runs a kiosk business to assist her husband in generating more income for their family.

She initiated the business using her own capital. Bath soap, detergent, stationery, cigarettes, candies, and snacks are available in her kiosk. Currently, Efa wants to add more goods to her kiosk inventory because some goods ordered by her customers are not available at her kiosk, such as sugar, coffee, cooking oil, and kitchen equipment. To purchase the goods, Efa needs more money. She has requested a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell in her kiosk

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been operating a general store business in the Philippines for 11 years. She earns additional income selling dry goods.

Having repaid her previous loan, Marisol is borrowing PHP 40000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.  to further build her businesses.

Marisol has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money  to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, various beverages and more to sell.

loans.name: Maria Flora

texts.en:
Maria Flora is 50 years old and married. She has one child, who is in school.

Maria Flora is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Flora has been in pig fattening for seven years now and has borrowed from NWTF 24 times in the past to sustain her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Hermocilla

texts.en:
Hermocilla is 41 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Hermocilla has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Hermocilla has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future and to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish and vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Marivic has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish and vegetables to sell in her stall.

Marivic has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and vegetables to sell in her stall

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Theary is married woman from Kampong Speu Province. She is the lovely mother of three children, two of whom are single, and one is married. 

She is a vegetable seller in a market in Phnom Penh City. So far, she has been in this business for a year. On average, she is able to make an income of six USD dollars a day.

Recently, some parts of her house deteriorated; they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living space for the household. Due to lack of funds, Theary has applied for a KIVA loan via HKL to buy construction materials to renovate her house. 

She -- and her family -- will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with a loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her home renovations

loans.name: Raqueza

texts.en: Raqueza is 55 years old, married and has three children, and living in Ozamiz City. She has been selling foodstuff in their villages for over eight years and she earns good income for the family. Her previous loan was used for the purchase of raw ingredients and has been repaid successfully. She took a new loan recently to buy ingredients and new utensils for her canteen. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to renovate their cafeteria and their own house for a comfortable living of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and new untensils for her canteen.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe grows and harvests corn, which is work she's done since she was young.  She gets up early and goes to the fields, where she has to take care of her cattle as well as her crops. 

Fe is requesting this loan to purchase organic fertilizer, since she needs to improve her corn harvest.    

In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now  She is sure she can achieve her goal of building her own house with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and improve her corn harvest

loans.name: Isabel Reyna

texts.es:
Isabel de 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos de8, 12, 19 y 25 años de edad, solo dos asisten a la escuela; su esposo es agricultor y solo él y sus hijos viven con ella. Isabel es ama de casa, se encarga de los oficio del hogar y cuidar sus hijos, también ayuda a su esposo con las labores agrícolas en la siembra y cosecha de hortalizas tomate, pepino, ayote y huisquil

El préstamo será utilizado para apoyar a sus dos hijas mayores en un negocio que tienen de venta de ropa, para comprar blusas, camisas, pantalones de todos los estilos y tallas y trajes para niños.
Isabel espera que a sus hijos les resulte bien la inversión y que aprovechen la temporada navideña, además espera que su otros dos hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Isabel, age 46, is married with 4 children, ages 8, 12, 19, and 25. Only two of them are attending school. Her husband is a farmer, and only he and their children live with her.  

Isabel is a housewife.  She is responsible for the household duties and for taking care of their children. She also helps her husband with the farm work, namely the planting and harvesting of vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers, azote, and huisquil (two kinds of squash).

The loan will be used to support her two oldest daughters in their clothing sales business, through the purchase of blouses, shirts, pants of all styles and sizes, and children's outfits.

Isabel hopes that the investment will turn out well for her children, and she hopes that they may make the most of the Christmas Season.  She also hopes that her other two children may complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, shirts, pants of all styles and sizes, and children's outfits.

loans.name: Aldrin

texts.en: Aldrin is 18 years old and from Talavera, Nueva Ecija. Their family’s income is from his father who is an OFW (Overseas Filipino worker). Even though his father is earning, it is sometimes not enough for all their expenses. That’s why he wants to avail an education loan of PHP 15,000 from Kiva lenders. Aldrin is taking up Mechatronics course. He wants to finish this course to find a stable job and help his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen  is 45 years and married.  She lives in Dulag, Leyte, together with her husband.  They have five children. Three of the children are still attending to school. 

Aileen is an entrepreneur, engage in buying and selling of frozen goods, like sausage and ham.  Aside from that, she is also into the retail business. She sells ready-to-wear clothing, like t-shirts, blouses, pants, and ladies jeans.  She has been engaged in this kind of business for almost four years now.

Aileen has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy additional stocks of frozen goods and additional stocks of RTW. 

Aileen hopes that she can maximize all the materials that will definitely change and improve her livelihood.  With these, she can provide her children with good food and better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen goods and stocks of ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 34 years old, married and has two children from Leyte, Philippines. Rosalinda runs a small sari-sari or retail store selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Rosalinda has been in the business for more than 14 years now. 

Rosalinda is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries, condiments, soda, coffee, sugar and others. Rosalinda believes that this loan will allow her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Rosalinda wants to expand her store so that it will become more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money so that she can continue to support her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries, etc.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel has been helping her husband in working their own farm to make a living. Her budget with her previous income from farming was not enough to cover the costs of fertilization of the entire farm. So she took a new loan recently to buy additional organic fertilizer for her farm. She is hopeful of gaining more income from her farm for she has invested more capital in order to improve her farm.

loans.use: to buy additional organic fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
A married mother of two children, Leonora works hard to support her family. She has a business selling seafood in the Philippines and also earns income from pig fattening.

Leonora is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell to her customers.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Jonadil

texts.en:
Jonadil is 38 years old, and she is married, with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional 
fertilizers and other supplies.

Jonadil has been farming rice for 10 years, and she also earns income from leasing farm equipment.

She successfully repaid her previous loan.  Now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, soap, etc. to sell through her general store business.

Lolita has been in this business for 10 years. Lolita earns more income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Рустам  родился 1986 году в городе Истаравшан. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. Его жену зовут Зулхумор. Она домохозяйка. Рустам трудолюбивый парень, очень любит семью и старается для благополучия своей семьи. Он живёт  вместе родителями и женой. 
  Рустам  работает на базаре.Он продаёт сухофрукты. Он покупает товар у дехкан по оптовой цене и продает их в розницу. Каждый день его выручка составляет 200-400 сомони и чистый доход у него составляет  50-60 сомони. 
  Рустам хочет получить кредит для покупки автомобиля. Это облегчит его работу по перевозке товаров. Для этого он обратился в МДО Арванд за кредитом.
 Рустам заранее благодарит  за доверие и взаимопонимание. СПАСИБО - «АРВАНД»!!!
         
.
texts.en: Rustam was born in Istaravshan in 1986.  He's married with one child, and lives with his parents and his wife Zulkhumor, who tends to their home.  Rustam is a hardworking young man who loves his family more than anything and does his best to provide for them.  He deals in dried fruit for a living, first buying it wholesale from farmers then selling it retail at a bazaar.  His daily revenue ranges from 200 to 400 somoni, and his daily net income is 50 to 60 somoni.  Rustam is seeking a loan from MDO Arvand to buy a car so he'll have an easier time bringing his wares to market, and would like to thank them in advance for their trust and understanding.

loans.use: buy a car

loans.name: Evan

texts.en: Evan is a hard-working mom, who makes a living with her own banana farm where she earns well, while her husband works as an electrician. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for farming.  She took a new loan recently to be used for buying organic fertilizer for a productive farm. Rest assured she will have a better future, for she is determined to have it.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for a productive farm.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As themarried mother of five children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from buying and selling charcoal and from fattening pigs. Angelita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan.  Now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Angelita has sustained her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials to maintain her fishing business

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Mujeres Valientes,  haciendo honor a las mujeres quienes la integran, por la destreza, dedicación y esfuerzo que ponen en sus labores y por sus ganas de ir escalando cada vez más.
Una de las integrantes de este comité es la señora  Lilian es muy activa, y se desempeña como capataz en una estancia y es cocinera a la vez, es muy guapa y genera entusiasmo en sus compañeras.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la  compra de insumos para poder seguir con la elaboración de sus comidas, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos, y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder crecer en sus emprendimientos.
texts.en:
This committee is named Mujeres Valientes (Valiant Women), to honor the women who are members, for the skill, dedication and effort they put into their work and for their desire to keep getting ahead little by little. 

One of the members of this committee is Lilian. She is very active and works as the foreman of a ranch and a cook at the same time. She is a very able worker and inspires enthusiasm in the other women in the group.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of supplies so she can continue to prepare her dishes, such as meat, vegetables, condiments, etc. She is grateful for the opportunity that they all are receiving so they can grow in their endeavors.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
This is Marissa. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to purchase additional supplies food supplements and herbal products which were needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expense of her youngest child and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 19,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of merchandise like herbal medicines and food supplements that she resells. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also help her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Marissa wants to save enough for her dream house, lot and a new car. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional supply of herbal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 40-year-old married woman, and a mother of two grown up children from Leyte, Philippines. She has a sari-sari or retail store, which provides her the income that she needs. She has been in the business for more than two years now. 

Susan needs more capital for the development of her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more groceries for the store like rice, canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. This loan will allow her to augment her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.  In the future, Susan hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for the store like rice, canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 67 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business direct-selling personal and Avon products in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Editha has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her direct-selling personal and Avon products business for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of personal and Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 42 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Imelda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Imelda has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fidel Antonio

texts.es:
Fidel de 22 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, su pareja es ama de casa y administra la tienda y la venta de ropa en su casa. Fidel es peluquero desde hace 10 años, se decidió por este negocio porque quería trabajar en su casa, tiempo después decidió poner la tienda y la venta de ropa que maneja desde hace más de 3 años.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una refrigeradora y ropa de diversas tallas y estilos para su negocio aprovechando la temporada navideña que se acerca que es cuando aumentan las ventas
Fidel sueña con que su hijo se gradúe de la universidad como contador, ya que es lo que le hubiese gustado a él, pero respetara la decisión que tome su hijo.
texts.en:
Fidel is 22 years old, married and has a 3 year old son. His spouse is a housewife, takes care of the store and sells clothing in her house. Fidel has been a hairdresser for 10 years and he decided on this business as he wanted to work at his house. Some time later he decided to open the store and the clothing sales and has been running this for more than 3 years.

The loan will be used to buy a fridge and clothing of different styles and sizes for his business taking advantage of the Christmas season which is approaching when sales increase. Fidel dreams of his son graduating from university as an accountant as this is what he would have liked to be. But he will respect the decisions taken by his son.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and clothing of different styles and sizes for his business

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Sixty-four-year-old Natividad engages in buying and selling dry goods like plasticware. She has a stall inside the market place. She is married and has four grown children. She lives in Dulag, Leyte. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 20 years. Natividad is standing in front of a motorcycle loaded with merchandise going to the market.

Natividad has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy various kinds of plasticware and to pay for transportation expenses. This will help Natividad operate and get her livelihood back to normal and will attract more buyers due to the variety of merchandise acquired.

Natividad is hoping that she will be productive in managing her business in a way that will definitely change and improve her family's way of living.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of plasticware to sell, and to pay for transportation expenses

loans.name: Alvin

texts.en:
Alvin, a fish vendor residing in Dulag, Leyte,  is married and has five children. His oldest child is 23 and the youngest is 11 years old.  Alvin's wife is a food vendor who sells snack food to help augment the family's income.

Alvin, who can now afford to buy nutritious food for the whole family, has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase a variety of fresh fish and additional stocks for food vending. This will improve the quantity of fish sold and also create higher earnings.

Alvin  hopes to have a stable income that will help send his children to school for brighter futures.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fresh fish and additional stocks for food vending

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a 31-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through her sari-sari (retail convenience store) business where she sells various goods and items to the people nearby. This business provides her the income that she needs. 

Analie is requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and animal feed. This loan will enable her to improve her store and attract more buyers. In the future, Analie hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and animal feed.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Grace has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 39 years old and married with three children who are in school. Maricel works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock such as canned goods, eggs, milk, etc. to sell in her store.

Maricel has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as canned goods, eggs, milk, etc. to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Gemme

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gemme works hard to support her family. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall for her fruit vending business.

Gemme has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru: Ирина, 26 лет, замужем. Имеет 2 детей дошкольного возраста. Семья очень дружная и уважаемая. У Ирины высшее образование, она работает в школе учителем математики. Также занимается животноводством. Бизнес Ирина начала в 2008 году, на сегодняшний день она успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, в котором у нее имеется: 2 лошади, 2 коровы, 20 овец и 15 коз. Ежемесячная прибыль Ирины составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Всю прибыль от хозяйства она старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Ирина обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков и овец. Она хочет увеличить поголовье скота и накопить средства на покупку автомобиля для ее семьи.
texts.en: Irina is 26, married, and has two children who are as yet too young to go to school.  Her family members are all on good terms with each other, and her family is respected by many people.  Irina has a university education and works at a school as a math teacher while also raising livestock for a living.  She first started her livestock business in 2008, and is now a successful farmer with her own small farm consisting of two horses, two cows, twenty sheep and fifteen goats, while her net income each month is around 15,000 som.  Irina is seeking a loan of 100,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy two bull calves and some sheep.  She tries her best to reinvest all her extra money back into her business, and wants to bolster her livestock headcount as well as set aside money for a new car for her family.

loans.use: buy two bull calves and some sheep to expand her business

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 35 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Marlyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Marlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future, Marlyn would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Rith, 28, is a married man who lives in a small community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has only one little child who is currently enrolled in school. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland, which is located near his house. On his farmland, he grows rice and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, he can generate an earning of USD 5.00 per day.

Recently, he came up with a new business idea. He wants to co-open a tailor shop with his brother. This tailor shop will be located in Phnom Penh City and will be managed by his brother. Because there is a shortage of capital investment, he is borrowing money from KIVA to buy tailoring materials such as scissors, sewing machines, cloth, measuring tapes, needles, and so on. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to open a tailor shop.

loans.name: Efepania

texts.en:
Efepania is 48 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of food to sell.

Efepania has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 24 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fermented duck eggs.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of food to sell

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Lina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ma. Lina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Ma. Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lanie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling fermented duck eggs. Lanie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of foods to sell for her food vending business.

Lanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of food to sell

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 40-year-old married woman. She is keen to provide her family with a better standard of living. She has been involved in the business of cloth trading. 

She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Asia has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors so her business will get a boost in earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings

loans.name: Romano

texts.en:
Romano has started his small business and become a boss with his sari-sari store. His wife manages to have enough inventory and rolls up their capital to gain more profits. 

Every day they make good sales since it is the only store in the barangay. Recently he approached Paglaum for his much needed capital to restock the store with basic commodities.

At the same time he is also a security guard in an establishment.  In the future, he hopes to have a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock the store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce and other commodities

loans.name: Feleciana

texts.en:
Feleciana is managing her eatery business in Dipolog City. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well and has been supporting the needs of the family. 

She has local customers and also accepts catering business for added income. Recently, she was loaned money to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Gracelda

texts.en:
Gracelda is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income, and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. 

She wants to improve the living situation of her family. She applied for a loan to repair her house, the money she borrowed is intended to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. Gracelda hopes to live a happy and comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 57 years old, married, and has a fish selling business in Canubay, Oroquieta. This is how she supports her husband and raises their family. 

She earns money with a meagre income of PHP 3,000 per month. Recently, Gloria availed a loan to purchase Nipa thatch for roofing. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase Nipa thatch for roofing

loans.name: Mavsuma

texts.ru:
Мавсума молодая жительница не большого района Кубадиён. Ей всего 20 лет. У нее нет высшего образования. Она работает в пекарне и печет традиционные лепешки. Уже 2,5 года она занята данной деятельностью. 
    Мавсума как многие жители сейчас занята ремонтом дома. Она хочет отремонтировать дом и приготовить жилище к предстоящим холодам. Для купли стройматериалов у нее хватает денег. Единственный способ она видит в получения кредита. Поддержите Мавсуму.
texts.en: Mavsuma is a young resident of the small district of Qubadiyon.  She is only 20 years old and she doesn't have a higher education.  She works in a bakery and bakes traditional cakes.  She has been involved in this activity for two-and-a-half years already.  Like many of her district's residents, she is currently repairing her house.  She wants to renovate her home and prepare it for the coming cold season.  She doesn't have enough money to buy building materials, and the only option she sees is to take a loan.  Please support her.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her home.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income, and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. 

She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. At the same time Virginia has a small sari-sari store. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida is 57 years old and married with one child who is in school, Nelida works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, coffee, eggs, noodles, etc.
.
Nelida has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, coffee, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Labao

texts.en:
Labao works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell.

Labao has been in this business for two years now. In the future, Labao would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
Aireen is 29 years old and has three children.  Aireen is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Aireen requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Aireen has been raising pigs for one year now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aireen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more additional sacks of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в магазине Нургул есть товар на сумму 120,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение ассортимента товара в магазине. Доходы от бизнеса Нургул планирует направить на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Nurgul successfully repaid her previous loan after using it as intended.  She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped her get this financing. Nurgul's inventory of goods is currently worth 120,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to increase her store's inventory.  She is planning to use her earnings to further develop her business.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of goods in her store in order to attract new customers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es:
Teresita


 Madre nicaragüense de 5 hijos, humilde y trabajadora, a sus 47 años lucha por sacarlos  adelante, mediante el estudio y un buen ejemplo de vida. El esfuerzo de Teresita y el apoyo de gente conocida le permiten abrir su tiendita hace 2 años y mantiene la venta de comidas, por lo que se hizo conocida en la zona, los fines de semana.
