Después de la visita y compartiendo las carencias de esta familia, se nota la educación buen trato y amabilidad de sus integrantes, que trabajan en equipo para lograr una mejor calidad de vida. Su hija menor está en cuarto año de la escuela con excelentes calificaciones.

 El trabajo en la venta de comidas y el apoyo de sus hijas le permite acondicionar el frente de su humilde vivienda y con materiales que muchos consideraríamos desecho, armo sus estantes, sus exhibidores, su escritorio de trabajo y caja, abriendo así su tienda en la comunidad. En 3 años de trabajo se ha establecido y ofrece mercadería de moda y sandalias muy populares en la zona de Puntarenas. Revisando los documentos del negocio, los ingresos adicionales con las comidas y el apoyo de sus hijas, la actividad, que es un conjunto de aportes de toda la familia, les permite atender sus clientes y ofrecer mercadería de muy buena calidad. El préstamo le va a permitir comprar y diversificar sus productos, crecer y apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio, que es su principal objetivo.

 La tiendita está localizada en un barrio pobre de la zona de Puntarenas, desea invertir en ropa para la temporada de fin de año y vacaciones de verano. Ejemplo en la zona de esfuerzo y dedicación por sus hijos, su tienda es única en la zona y referencia para muchas personas para comprar ropa de moda y calidad pese a las condiciones humildes de su local. Los fines de semana venden comida y con el apoyo de sus hijos menores atiende el negocio. Desea que ellos sigan estudiando y logren sacar una carrera, mejorando así su nivel de vida. Sueña con mejorar su casa y su tienda en un futuro.
texts.en:
Teresita,
Nicaraguan mother to 5 children, humble and a hard worker. At 47 years old she fights to get them ahead through education and a good life example. Teresita’s efforts and the support of the people she knows allowed her to open her small store 2 years ago and to maintain her weekend food sales, by which she became well known in the area. After visiting and sharing in this family’s poverty, one notices the good manners and friendliness of its members who work as a team to achieve a better quality of life. Her youngest daughter is in fourth grade with excellent marks.

Her work selling food and the support of her daughters allow her to fix up the front of her humble home with materials that many consider rubbish. She set up her shelves, racks, work desk and cash register, thus opening up her store to the community. She has established herself during 3 years working and offers fashion merchandise and sandals that are very popular in the Puntarenas area. In reviewing business documents, the additional income from food and the support of her daughters, this business, which is a group effort from all of the family, allows them to attend to their customers and to offer very high quality merchandise. The loan will allow her to purchase and diversify her products, to grow and to support her children in school, which is her main objective.

The store is located in a poor neighborhood in the Puntarenas area. She wishes to invest in seasonal clothing for new years and for summer vacation.
An example in the area for effort and dedication to her children, her store is unique in the area and a reference for many people who buy quality, fashionable clothing in spite of her store’s humble conditions.  With the support of her youngest children they sell food on the weekends and tend to the business. She wants them to continue studying and to obtain a career, thus improving their standard of living. She dreams of improving her home and her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for men, women and children for new years and for vacation.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 46, is married and lives in Binuangan, Oroquieta, Philippines. She has an adult-age son. In order to help the family, she engages in dried fish and processed meat vending. PMPC supported her to start her chosen business. It has operated for six years already. 

Jocelyn thought of expanding her resources. She is planning to borrow PHP 10,000 from PMPC; she became a member in 2013. She will use the loan to buy additional stock of dried fish to sell. She wants to have a stall in the public market to display her dried fish, and to be able to sell meat too. Someday she will be happy seeing her family with a comfortable life, and live happily with them.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dried fish and processed meat to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma signed up her membership with PMPC and availed herself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital extended to a small time loaner like her. Vilma is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to restock the store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to mount a descent home for the family. Also she has a sideline doing manicures and pedicures.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Bo's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bo, who was born in 1988, has been participating in the program since 2011. She is one of the youngest members of the cluster. She currently lives with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Bo's family’s main income is from cultivation and livestock breeding, so it is just temporarily enough to cover food and save a little amount. But, it is not enough to buy fertilizer for the next crops. So, she wants to take a loan to buy fertilizer for her coffee field. 

Bo expects, thanks to the loan amount, that it will help her to invest effectively in her coffee field. The coffee field will be laden with fruits bringing her family  a significant profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee field

loans.name: Đình

texts.en:
Đình is 52 years old and he is married with two children. He lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Đình has a service business tailoring clothes. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Đình faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet. This is Đình's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Đình hopes for his children to find a good job, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Phala

texts.en:
Phala, who is 50 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has only one little child. He is a security guard with a daily salary around $5.00 (USD), on average. So far, he has been in this career for one year. His wife, Samoun, 42, has been a garment factory worker since 2011. On average, she can make an income around $6.00 (USD) per day. 
 
Phala would like to apply for a Kiva loan via HKL and he is going to use this loan to buy jewelry. Phala thinks that now the price of gold seems to have decreased, thus it is a good time for him to buy jewelry at a low price and keep it to sell when its price increases. 

Phala is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 51 years old, and married with two adult-age children. She has a little sari-sari store that she owns where she generates income to help sustain the needs of her family. To continue operation her business, she wants to borrow an amount of PHP 10,000 to provide for the needs of her customers. Antonia is very happy with the help provided.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, biscuits, candies, powder soaps, etc. to maintain the operation of the business.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 60 years old, married, and has a small piggery business in Aloran. This is how she supports her family with a meagre income of PHP 5,000 per month in addition to the income of her husband. Recently, Loreta availed herself of a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Nela

texts.en: Nela, 43, is married with three children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 15 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially for the education of her children. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her family. She already availed herself of loans previously to purchase additional stock and now she is reapplying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income, and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and to increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married woman with six children. Ali is 41 years old and has four children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ali has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ali requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gears for her business.

Ali has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ali would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gears for her business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia works hard to support her family. Amalia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Amalia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Amalia has been in this business for ten years now.

Amalia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гулзат, 42 года, вдова, мать 5 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2005 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Гулзат на сегодняшний день имеет 1 корову, 8 овец и 4 лошади. Также у Гулзат есть 0,8 ГА собственной земельной доли, на которой она выращивает кукурузу и люцерну. Ежемесячная прибыль Гулзат составляет 8,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь Гулзат и ее детей. Поэтому она в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Гулзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, что позволит улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Gulzat is 42 years old, a widow, and the mother of five children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education.  In order to provide her family with an additional source of income, she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture since 2005.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns one cow, eight sheep and four horses.  She also owns 0.8 hectare of land on which she grows corn and alfalfa.  She makes a monthly income of 8,000 som (KGS), which is vastly insufficient to provide her family and herself with decent living conditions.  For this reason, and to further grow her business, Gulzat has turned to Bai Tushum for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy sheep for fattening and resale.  She plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further developing her farming business, which will help her to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale, in order to increase her source of income.

loans.name: Anelor

texts.en:
Anelor is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and has six children who are currently in school.

Anelor has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Anelor has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nazrbi

texts.ru:
Женщину на фотографии зовут Назрби. Она не замужем. Ей 33 года. Назрби живет вместе с родителями, братом и женой брата. Отец Назрби работает охранником в школе. Брат занимается продажей продуктов питания. Назрби в течение 5 лет занимается шитьем "курпы" и "курпачи".
      "Курпа" и "курпача"- это ватные матрасы. "Курпа" шьют стандартно квадратном размере, ее используют в качестве одеяла. Курпача длинные матрасы используется как диваны. 
   Причина, по которой Назрби обратилась за кредитом это нехватка денег на приобретения новой современной машинки. Благодаря новой машинке, она сможет улучшить качество работы и ускорить процесс работы.
texts.en: The woman in the photo is Nazrbi.  She's 33, unmarried, and lives with her parents, brother and his wife.  Nazrbi's father works as a school security guard and her brother sells food items for a living, while Nazrbi has worked as a seamstress for the past 5 years making quilted mats called "krupas" and "krupachas".  Krupas are sewn in a standard square shape and are used as blankets, while krupachas are long mats that are used to sit on as you would a couch.  Nazrbi is seeking a loan as she lacks the money to buy a new sewing machine.  This new machine will allow her to improve the quality of her work as well as allow her to work faster.

loans.use: buy a new modern sewing machine

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is woman native from Mayorga, Leyte. She is 45 year old. She earns a living by raising and selling hogs. She has been raising hogs for eight years already. Aside from hog raising, Arlyn also into farming. She grows and sells rice. She is married and has two children aged three and eight years old respectively.

Arlyn has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, rice seedlings and additional pigs. These are essential tools in making her livelihood more productive.

In the future, Arlyn hopes that she would expand her business to be successful and would continue support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, rice seedlings and additional pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is grateful that she was granted a 35,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy hogs and hog feed. Through her diligence and hard work she was able to recover from her loss during the typhoon, and was able to start selling grocery items at her home. In her photo she is shown at her piggery farm. This is how she is able to support her family's everyday needs. 

She would like to apply now for a PHP 40,000 loan, which she will use to buy hog feed and grocery items such as rice, noodles, beverages and toiletries to earn additional income. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial help that will be given her.

Gina dreams of being able to give her children the best education possible, so they can have a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy hog feed for her piggery farm and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano is a married man, and a father of two grown up children, from Leyte, Philippines. 

Luciano and his wife own a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in their area. This is the source of their income for the past thirty one years.

Luciano is asking for a loan to buy more groceries like rice, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, toiletries, soap, condiments and others. This loan will allow him to increase his stock thereby attracting more buyers to his store.

Luciano hopes to make his business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like rice, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, toiletries, soap, condiments and others.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 44 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Analiza works very hard to provide for them.

Analiza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as biscuits, soft-drinks, cereals, sanitary pads, chocolate drinks, toothpaste, etc. Analiza has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as biscuits, soft-drinks, cereals, sanitary pads, chocolate drinks, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Risty

texts.en:
Risty is 40 years old and married with five children, all of whom attend school. Risty works very hard to provide for them.

Risty runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Risty has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, sardines and other groceries.

In the future Risty would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 59 years old and single.

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Anita has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Anita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Rosie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Rosie's business profile again for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Avelina requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Avelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 55 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Edna works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Edna has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ulan

texts.ru: Улан, 28 лет, женат, есть годовалый сын. У него среднее образование, с 2008 года занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве Улана на сегодняшний день есть: 2 лошади, 2 коровы с телятами и 10 овец, на ежедневной основе он реализует молоко. Ежемесячная прибыль Улана составляет свыше 10,000 сом (KGS), в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк "Бай Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота. Доходы от бизнеса помогут улучшить благосостояние Улана, а также накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Ulan is 28 years old, married, and has a one-year-old son. He has a secondary education. Since 2008, he has been raising livestock. On his homestead, Ulan currently has: two horses, two cows with calves, and ten sheep, his main source of daily milk. Ulan's monthly profits amount to over 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing his homestead, he applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 45,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock feed.

Profits from the business will help Ulan's well-being and similarly to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Ena Ilvea

texts.es:
Ena de 34 años de edad,  está acompañada y tiene un hijo que está estudiando; ella solo estudio hasta 4° grado de educación básica, es ama de casa, su esposo reside en el extranjero y le apoya económicamente. Ena tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la crianza de ganado, aprendió con su suegro que tenía ganado y ella se lo cuidaba y termino por gustarle el oficio, ahora ella se dedica a lo mismo.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar un  toro, pues comenta que para cargar sus vacas la lleva a otro lugar y termina siendo muy costoso obtener crías. Ena sueña con fortalecer su negocio y tener algún día una ganadería reconocida y que su hijo termine sus estudios en la universidad.
texts.en:
Ena is 34 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She only studied up to the 4th grade.  Ena is a housewife and her husband lives overseas. He supports her financially.

Ena has been raising livestock for eight years. She learned this trade from her father-in-law who had livestock which she took care of. She enjoyed the work and now she works at the same trade.

The loan will be used to buy a bull. She states that to breed her cows she had to take them to another location and it was very costly to obtain calves. Ena dreams of strengthening her business and one day to have a well-known livestock business and for her son to finish his university studies.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru:
Латофат талантливая женщина из района Бохтар. Ей 48 лет. Она занимается кройкой и шитьем женских одеяний национального стиля. У Латофат большой опыт работы в этой деятельности. Она предоставляет услуги швеи на протяжении более 15 лет. С заказами ей помогает ее младшая дочь. У Латофат трое детей. Дочерям по 28 и 17 лет, а сыну 13 лет. Ее муж является трудовым мигрантом России.
Латофат нравится ее деятельность, особенно реализовывать свои фантазии на платьях. Она получает положительную энергию от восторженных лиц клиентов, когда они приходят за готовыми заказами. 
В данный момент Латофат собирается купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку для продвижения деятельности. В дальнейшем она хочет расширить сферу своих услуг и брать заказы на пошив и европейских платьев.
texts.en:
Latofat is a talented woman from the Bokhtar region. She is 48 years old. She is engaged in cutting and sewing women's clothing in the national style. Latofat has a lot of work experience in this activity. She has been offering sewing services for the more than the last 15 years. Her youngest daughter helps her with orders. Latofat has three children. Her daughters are 28 and 17 years old, and her son is 13. Her husband is a labor migrant in Russia.

Latofat likes her activity, especially creating her fantasies on the dresses. She gets positive energy from the enthusiastic faces of her clients, when they come for their completed orders.

Currently, Latofat intends to buy a new modernized sewing machine to promote her activities. In the future, she wants to expand the sphere of her services and to take orders for tailoring and European dresses.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for developing her trade.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора проживает на районе Хамадони. Гулнора прекрасная женщина с чистой душой. Ей 42 года. Гулнора замужем. Ее муж, как и многие жители находиться на заработках заграницей. У нее пятеро детей(2 дочки и 3 сына). Гулнора возле дома имеет не большой магазин продуктов питания. Она открыла магазин 5 лет назад и по сей день она продвигает свою деятельность и старается расширяться, создать устойчивый бизнес и стать хорошим предпринимателем. На данный момент Гулноре необходимо привезти новый товар на продажу, но она не имеет достаточную сумму денег для закупки и привозки товара и Гульнора надеется на Вашу доброту и поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulnora resides in the Khamadoni region. Gulnora is a pleasant woman with a good heart. She is 42 years old. Gulnora is married. Her husband, like many residents has gone abroad for work. She has five children (two daughters and three sons). Outside of her home, Gulnora has a small grocery store. She opened the store five years ago and to this day she is promoting her activities and striving to expand, to create a sustainable business, and to become a good entrepreneur.

Currently, Gulnora needs to transport new goods for sale, but she does not have enough money to buy and transport the goods and Gulnora hopes for kindness and support.

loans.use: to purchase and transport grocery products.

loans.name: Cleare

texts.en:
Cleare is 28 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cleare has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing netting for her fishing business.

Cleare has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing netting for her fishing business.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel is 32 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, coffee, egg, etc.

Rechel has borrowed and paid back 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, coffee, egg, etc.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 50 years old and has five children. Concepcion is married and has three children who are still in school.

Concepcion is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Concepcion requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Concepcion has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Florita is 35 years old and has six children who are in school.

Florita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Florita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Florita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Florita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 49 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for it.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, etc. Carmelita has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Она Заррина. Ей 27 лет. Она проживает в городке под названием Куляб. Она является преподавателем в местной школе. В свободное от работы время, Заррина принимает заказы на шитье женской одежды, на дому. Для нее дополнительный источник дохода является обязательной, потому что заплата учителя является очень маленькой. Заррина вынуждена подрабатывать. Сейчас ей необходимо купить новую швейную машинку и сохранить источник дохода, потому что нынешняя машинка совсем устарела и не пригодна для работы. Она надеется, что ей не откажут в кредите, и она реализует покупку.
texts.en:
This is Zarrina. She is 27 years old. She resides in the town known as Kulyab. She is a teacher at a local school. In her free time from work, Zarrina accepts orders for sewing women's clothing at home. For her an additional source of income is required because her teacher's salary is very small. Zarrina was forced to look for jobs.

Now, she needs to buy a new sewing machine and to preserve a source of income, because her current machine is completely outdated and not suitable for work. She hopes that she is not refused and that she will complete her purchase.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and to preserve a source of income.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
La Sra. Clementina es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se esfuerza para poder seguir con su trabajo, tiene 3 hijos a quienes con mucho sacrificio pudo sacar adelante y son fruto de su sacrificio y esfuerzo. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en la compra de joyas de plata para la venta.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de joyas de plata variadas para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Clementina is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who makes an effort in order to be able to continue with her work. She has 3 children, whom she was able to move forward with great sacrifice, and they are the fruit of her sacrifice and effort. She notes that she used her previous loan to buy silver jewelry to sell.

Today she is asking for a new loan in order to be able to buy a variety of silver jewelry in order to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of silver jewelry

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is thankful for the 19,000 PHP loan that was previously granted to her. She has used the loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, as well as their personal, household and business expenditures.

Elvie would like to apply for another loan, this time in the amount of 13,000 PHP. She will buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elvie wants to expand her store and she desires for her children to finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 56 years old and a married woman with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Virginia has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. Virginia has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Gloria has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, seasonings, detergent soap, shampoo, hair conditioners, etc. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Emerlyn

texts.en:
Emerlyn is 34 years old and has two children. Emerlyn is married and her two children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Emerlyn requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Emerlyn has been pig fattening for 9 years now, and has borrowed 44 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emerlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is 57 years old, married and has one child.  

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Estrelita requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Estrelita has been pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Estrelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 54 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns additional income from fish and vegetable vending.

Janet aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rudilio Alexander

texts.es:
Rudilio de 26 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijas solo una estudia. Él estudió hasta 6° grado de educación básica, dejo la escuela para trabajar y apoyar a su familia, su pareja es ama de casa.

Rudilio es jornalero, tiene 4 años trabajando en el cuido de ganado para unas personas en su comunidad, su horario es de lunes a sábado de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm, antes se dedicaba a los trabajos agrícolas. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una ternera, tiene la oportunidad de que se la venden a buen precio y quiere aprovechar de hacer un buen negocio para sacar provecho a futuro. Rudilio sueña con comprar mas ganado para tener sus propios animales y hacerlos producir.
texts.en:
Rudilio, 26 years old, has a partner and 2 daughters; only one is in school. He studied through the 6th grade of primary school. He left school to work and help his family. His partner is a housewife.

Rudilio is a day laborer. For 4 years, he has been taking care of cattle for some people in his community. His schedule is Monday through Saturday from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. He was doing farm work before. He needs the loan to buy a calf. He has the opportunity to buy one at a good price and he wants to take advantage of getting a good deal in order to make the most of the future. Rudilio dreams of buying more cattle in order to have his own animals and have them produce.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 18 mujeres inspiradas en la idea de tener  un progreso digno y mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de cada una de ellas, y no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Una persona que se destaca por ser una mujer muy trabajadora es la Sra. Aparicia, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que luego sale a vender. Comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, todo esto gracias a que sus comidas son muy ricas y les gusta mucho a sus clientes, es por eso que quiere seguir con su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas como lo viene haciendo, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, hortalizas y demás. Todas las integrantes están agradecidas por la ayuda que reciben y que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank is made up of 18 women inspired by the idea of progressing with dignity and improving the quality of life of each one of them, not only financially, but also personally.

One person who stands out for being a very hard-working woman is Aparicia. She sells meals that she makes herself and then goes out to sell. She notes that she has gotten a very good clientele, all thanks to the fact that her meals are very delicious and her customers like them a lot. That is why she wants to continue with her work.

She is asking for this loan in order to be able to buy supplies in order to be able to make her meals as she has been doing, such as greens, condiments, meat, vegetables, and more. All of the members are grateful for the help they receive and it will be of great help to them.

loans.use: to buy greens, condiments, meat, vegetables, and more to make meals

loans.name: Cresente

texts.en:
Cresente is a 59-year-old married man and a father of four grown children from Leyte, Philippines. 

He runs a small sari-sari or retail (variety) store business selling goods such as soap, detergents and food items. This is the source of his income. Cresente has been in the business for more than 20 years now.

Cresente is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, coffee, sugar, cooking oil and condiments. With this, he will be able to improve his stock, which will attract more buyers to his store. 

In the future, Cresente hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, coffee, sugar, cooking oil and condiments

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Rosalia runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household items like powdered milk, biscuits, matches,cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, toothpaste, shampoo and beverages.

She is married and has three children ages 19, 15 and 12 years old. She started operating a store almost three years ago. Her husband is a farmer. He grows and sells rice.

Rosalia has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchased assorted stock of coffee, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. This could attract more buyers and increase her sales, thus providing her family with nutritious food and better living conditions.

Rosalia would expand her current business for a sustainable living and to finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchased assorted stock of coffee, noodles, canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза женщина 40 лет,замужем,мать четверых детей.Она родилась в сельской местности и с детства приучена к тяжёлому труду на поле.Наргиза работает учителем в школе,но учительской зарплаты не хватает на семейные нужды.Поэтому она занимается животноводством.На своём участке земли она ухаживает за пятью коровами.Молоко ,полученное от коров,дочь Наргизы продаёт на рынке. Она хочет дать своим детям всё,чтобы они не знали нужд в жизни,чтобы получили хорошее образование и могли обеспечить себя благополучной жизнью.В этом году её старший сын закончил школу ,но у Наргизы нет полной суммы для оплаты образования.Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой .Наргиза надеется,что МДО Арванд откликнется на её просьбу о помощи и выделит её нужную сумму.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Nargiza is a 40-year-old woman, married, and the mother of four children. She was born in the countryside and since childhood has been accustomed to the hardships of the field. Nargiza works as a schoolteacher, but a teacher's salary is not sufficient for the family needs. Therefore, she raises livestock. On her own plot of land, she tends to five cows. The milk received from the cows is sold by Nargiza's daughter at the market. She wants to give her children everything so that they will not know the needs of life, in order to receive a good education and to be able to support themselves with a prosperous life.

This year, her eldest son graduated from high school, but Nargiza does not have the full sum to pay for his education. Therefore, she applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. Nargiza hopes that MDO Arvand will respond to her request for help and will allocate her the needed sum. She sends her thanks in advance for the support and trust.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 41 years old and married with four children. For the past five years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Julieta works very hard to provide for her family.

Julieta is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as noodles, canned goods, eggs, sugar, and other items. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, canned goods, eggs, sugar, and other products

loans.name: Paraiso Group

texts.es:
El grupo Paraiso  está en el 3º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, a través del cual podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar para mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirtha, ella  es modista y también se dedica a la venta de alfajores, en su última encuesta se encontraba mejorando su situación de la pobreza, pero de igual manera se sigue esforzando para poder mejorar su situación.
Mirtha pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder confeccionar, como ser telas, hilos, gomas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Paradise group is in its 3rd cycle of the women's committee program, where everyone works and helps each other to move forward. They are doing a survey for the elimination of poverty, through which each member can understand her life situation and work to improve it accordingly.

One of the members is Mirtha. She is a seamstress and also sells sandwich cookies. In her last survey, she was found to be improving her situation of poverty, but she is equally still working to improve her situation.

Mirtha is seeking this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of various inputs to be able to make clothes, such as fabrics, yarn, bands and more, to continue her work as she has been doing. She thanks everyone for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy fabric, yarn, bands and more.

loans.name: Jumdaya

texts.en:
Jumdaya is 59 years old and married with six children. For the past 20 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Jumdaya works very hard to provide for her family.

Jumdaya is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, noodles, and other products. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, canned goods, noodles, and other products

loans.name: Lenlie

texts.en:
Lenlie is a married woman with five children. Lenlie is 35 years old and has four children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lenlie has a fish and seafood vending business in the Philippines. Lenlie has been in this business for two years. Lenlie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and seafood to sell to her customers.

In the future, Lenlie would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and seafood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Joselita

texts.en:
Joselita is 51 years old and is a married woman with seven children, one of whom is in school. For the past two years, she has run a fishing business in the Philippines. Joselita is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Joselita is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials such as fish containers, gasoline, and other items for her business. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish containers, gasoline, and other items

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 44 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase canned goods, soap, coffee, milk and so on to sell. Marilyn has been in this business for three years. 

In the future Marilyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soap, coffee, milk, and so on, to sell

loans.name: Osias Alfides

texts.es:
Osias de 25 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, su pareja es ama de casa y solo ella y su hija dependen de él.

Osias es empleado, tiene más de 3 años trabando para una tienda que  vende aparatos electrónicos como accesorios para computadoras, trabaja de 7:00  am a 4:00 pm. El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una motocicleta que le servirá como medio de transporte de su casa al trabajo. Osias sueña con estudiar y prepararse académicamente, le gustaría estudiar ingeniería civil.
texts.en:
Osias is 25 years old, partnered and has a two-year-old child. He studied through high school. His partner is a housewife and only her and their daughter depend on him

Osias is employed. For three years, he's been working for a store that sells electronic goods like computer accessories. He works from 7am-4pm. 

The loan will be used to buy a motorcycle which will serve as a means of transportation from his home to work. Osias dreams of studying and academic preparation. He would like to study civil engineering.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. Lourdes is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lourdes requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lourdes has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo corazon de jesus 2 está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que a través de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores irán conociendo la vida de cada una e ir mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mariza quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, lo que quiere decir que se encuentra en un nivel medio, mejorando a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de comidas, como ser empanadas, Comidas variadas,  y otro. 
La Sra. Mariza solicita de este préstamo para la compra de Verduras, Carne, Huevo y otros, lo que le ayudará  a la misma a obtener más producción y mas venta de las comidas, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de ir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Corazón de Jesus 2 (Heart of Jesus 2) group is in its 7th cycle of the women's committee program. They are doing a survey for the elimination of poverty. Through 50 indicators, they will understand the life situation of each member and continue improving.

One of the members is Mariza, who in her last survey showed a poverty level inside level two. That means she's at a middle level, improving through effort, steady work and the sale of food like empanadas, various foods and more.

Mariza seeks this loan to buy vegetables, meat, eggs and more, which will help her increase production and sales of food at the same time, which will improve her income. All the members are grateful for the opportunity they have to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, eggs and more.

loans.name: Hurmatoy

texts.ru: Хурматой уроженка района Шахритус. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем и у нее растет сын. Муж Хурматоя работает строителем. Хурматой хочет помочь мужу в обеспечение семьи и начать зарабатывать. Она не нашла работу и решила создать свой бизнес. Она будет заниматься купля и продажей мелко рогатых скотин. У Хурматой имеется все условия для содержания скотин и начала животноводческой деятельности. Она запаслась кормом для них и ей необходимо купить только 8 голов барашек. Чтобы купить такое количество скотин у Хурматой не хватает средств, и она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы реализовать свой план.
texts.en: Hurmatoy is a native of the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan.  She is 48 years old.  She is married and the mother of one son.  Her husband works in construction.  Hurmatoy is trying to help her husband provide for the family, and she wants to start earning an income.  As she was not able to find work, she has decided to start her own business.  She will be buying and selling small livestock.  She has everything needed to keep livestock at home and to start her new activity.  She has gathered forage for her animals and she now only needs to buy eight lambs.  However, she doesn't have enough money to make this purchase, which is the reason why she has turned to Bai Tushum to achieve her plans.

loans.use: to buy eight lambs.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.es:
La señora Geronima tiene una despensa  en su  propia casa,  se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 10 años, y comenta que ya tiene una buena clientela formada.
Tiene un local bien surtido con todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad y una importante clientela ya formada ya que es una de las despensas mejor surtidas de la zona. Gracias a esta actividad  ha podido salir adelante, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con todo tipo de productos, como ser harina, fideos, arroz, carne y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo bien haciendo.
texts.en:
Geromina has a store in her own home. She's been working in this business for more than 10 years, and says she already has a good customer base.

She has a well-stocked location with all kinds of basic goods, and an important clintele that's already formed, as she's one of the best-stocked stores in her area. Thanks to this activity, she's been able to get ahead, maintain her home and pay for any unexpected expense.

She's asking for this loan to be able to stock her business with all kinds of products, like flour, noodles, rice, meat and more, so she can continue her sales as she does well.

loans.use: to buy flour, noodles, rice, meat and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking stoves or kalan.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 41 years old and married with five children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Clara has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years.

Clara requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married with six children. She is 59 years old and has one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosalinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years. 

Rosalinda requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 47 años, comenta que con mucho esfuerzo monto para su despensa-carnicería y logro estabilizar e ir agrandando, ella proviene de una familia de comerciantes y agricultores.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que se está esforzando por poder salir adelante y poder crecer. Pide este préstamo para la compra de verduras, frutas, hortalizas y demás productos, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Juana is 47 years old. She says she put lots of effort into opening her grocery store and butcher shop, and has been able to stabilize her business and expand it little by little. She comes from a family of retailers and farmers. She is a very driven woman and a hard worker, and she is doing her best to get ahead and grow. 

She is requesting this loan to buy vegetables, fruit, and other products so that she can keep working and helping her family as she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, and other products.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 32 years old and is married with one child who is currently in school. He lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. For the past eight years, Wilson has been working hard to manage his retail shop where he sells spare moto parts. 

Wilson is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more spare parts for his business. His loan will help Wilson generate greater profits and take care of his family. Wilson hopes that in the future he will be able to become the leading supplier of spare parts in town. 

Wilson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his business

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
This is Linda. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enriched her business. Linda operates a business selling cosmetics, clothing, footwear, and other direct-marketing products. She was able to use her loan to purchase additional merchandise products needed to increase her product inventory. Her loan also helped her provide for her family’s daily needs and expenses.

Linda is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase additional stocks of cosmetics, clothing, footwear, undergarments, and other merchandise items she needs for her direct selling business. Linda is very positive that she can improve her business with her loan. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, Linda could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Linda aims to be able to buy a house for her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, clothing, footwear, undergarments, and other merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her school fees.

loans.name: Abel Alfredo

texts.es: ABEL ALFREDO: Es un señor amable, originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 32 años de edad, casado, tiene un pequeño hijo de 6 meses. Con el propósito de construir su propia vivienda de tambo de madera, solicita financiamiento, para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, clavos, zinc, cubrir costo de transporte de materiales y mano de obra. Su sueño es comprar una moto y brindarle a su familia una vivienda con las mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Abel Alfredo is a friendly man originally from Puerto Cabezas. He is 32 years old, married, and has a small 6 month old son. With the proposal to build his own home of wood, he seeks financing to buy construction materials such as wood, nails, zinc, to cover the cost of transporting the materials as well as labor. His dream is to buy a motorcycle and provide his family a home with better living conditions.

loans.use: to build his own home of wood.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama San Expedito es un grupo nuevo que se motivaron a través de experiencias de otros grupos, el comité tiene 17 integrantes, todas deseosas de llevar adelante y acrecentar mas sus actividades para lograr mejorar la situación de vida de sus familias.
 Una de las integrantes que se caracteriza por ser  muy emprendedora es la Sra. María quien se dedica a la venta de ropa,  recorre por diversos lugares ofreciendo sus prendas con amabilidad y cordialidad, ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, y con ello tiene los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas varias, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
This communal bank's name is San Expedito. It is a new group, whose members were inspired by the experiences of other groups. Its members are seventeen women who are all eager to expand their businesses and keep moving forward in order to improve their families' living situation.

María belongs to this group and is known for her drive. She works selling clothing, and travels to different places offering her merchandise with kindness and friendliness. She already has a very good customer base and her work earns her the income she needs to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to invest in a variety of clothing items so that she can keep up her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria tiene un taller de costura, se dedica a esto desde varios años, esta casada con el Señor Arnaldo quien trabaja como constructor de obras, tienen dos hijos estudiantes, por quienes esta luchando para poder sacarlos adelante.
Ella se hizo ya muy conocida pues siempre hace muy buenos trabajos y gustan mucho a sus clientes. Comenta que solicita este préstamo para la compra de tela, accesorios, hilos, etc., de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria has a sewing workshop that she's earned a living with for several years. She is married to Arnaldo, who works in construction. They have two children in school, for whom they are striving to be able to get ahead.

She has already become very well-known because she always does very good work and likes her customers a lot. She says she's seeking this loan to buy fabric, accessories, thread, etc. so se can continue with her work as she's been doing.

She is thankful for the opportunity she's receiving to be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, accessories, thread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy structural support beams and zinc.

loans.name: Junia

texts.en:
Junia is a diligent mother who lives in a rural community with her family. She is 55 years old and blessed with five children. Junia is engaged in selling clothes in the public market to help her husband in generating income. 

Junia aims to continue and improve this business but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of pants, polo shirts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, shorts and jackets to sell. Junia is hoping that this financial assistance will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of pants, polo shirts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, shorts and jackets to sell

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is married and works hard to support her family. For the past 20 years, she has run a fishing business in the Philippines. Remy successfully repaid her previous loan and is requesting another loan to further build her business.

Remy is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fish net materials, plywood, and paint. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish net materials, plywood, and paint

loans.name: Fridah's Group

texts.en:
Fridah is 42 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very trustworthy person. Even though Fridah is the only one featured in the above photo, she is actually representing her group which has been formed by nine farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Fridah started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011. She decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Ever since then, Fridah has seen her life improve. This year, she decided to represent her group because she likes being a leader.

Fridah’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. In addition, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: 1 De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo de mujeres de nombre 1 de Noviembre está en su ciclo número 3, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Eva, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, lo que quiere decir que se encuentran en un nivel medio. Ella es vendedora ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser prendas, calzados y demás, y es por medio de este trabajo que lucha para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, como también de calzados, con lo cual podrá seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Ella se define a sí misma como una persona entusiasta y trabajadora.
texts.en:
1 De Noviembre is a group of women which is in its third cycle. Its members are completing the poverty elimination survey, which will allow them to know each of their situations and work on them accordingly.

Eva is one of its members. Her last survey showed a level 2 poverty level, which means she is at the intermediate level. She works as a street vendor, selling all sorts of products like clothing, shoes, and other items. She is trying hard to help her family through her work.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest it in purchasing assorted clothing items, as well as shoes, so that she can keep working like she has been doing so far. She describes herself as an enthusiastic and hardworking person.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Evanise

texts.en:
Evanise is a 47-year-old hard-working married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in shoe selling and runs a retail shop as her main source of income with farming enabling her to earn extra income. 

Evanise started this business so she could look after her family and educate her children.  She hopes to become rich and to extend her farm to serve her increasing number of customers. However, her main challenge is inadequate capital and weather changes. Evanise is requesting a loan to buy more shoes to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar applied for his first loan, which was provided by Kiva lenders, to purchase construction materials to complete the building of some rooms in his house. That loan helped him very much to accomplish the building of those rooms. He is very thankful to Kiva lenders for his first loan. 

As Anwar has finished repayment of all the instalments of the first loan, he has applied for a second loan of 200,000 YER in order to purchase construction materials such as steel, bricks, cement and sand to complete the rest of his house. This will allow him to build other rooms to make his house large enough for all members of his family. Anwar hopes to also receive this loan.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as steel, bricks, cement and sand to complete the rest of his house

loans.name: Juana Olivia

texts.es: Juana: Es una mujer luchadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 42 años de edad, casada tiene 3 hijos. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 6 años estableció su pequeña pulpería. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar chiverías, granos básicos, papel higiénico, sopas instantáneas, entre otros productos. Su sueño es concluir la construcción de su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en: Juana is a hard-working woman originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. With the goal of having her own source of income, 6 years ago she established a small convenience store. She seeks a second loan to buy snacks, basic grains, toilet paper, instant soups, and other products. Her dream is to finish construction of her concrete home.

loans.use: to buy snacks, basic grains, toilet paper, instant soups, and other products.

loans.name: El Eden Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Eden está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo conjunto.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas, como así también de churrascos llamados asaditos, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora.
La Sra. Maria solicita  este préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras y demás para la venta, lo que le ayudará a poder seguir con su trabajo en las ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas reciben de poder seguir luchando por sus familias.
texts.en:
The group El Eden is in its third cycle with the women's committee program. All of its members work and help each other get ahead. These women are heads of household who want to help their loved ones by working together.

Maria is one of its members. She is improving her business thanks to her effort, by working non-stop, and by practicing behaviors that lead to a woman's success. She works selling fruit, as well as barbecued meats called "churrascos" or "asaditos." She is a very driven and hardworking woman.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy fruits and vegetables and other items to sell, which will help her be able to continue working and to keep up her current sales. She appreciates the opportunity they are all getting to keep fighting for their families.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 62 years old and married.  He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He runs a retail shop as his main source of income, although he also practices farming for side income. It is from these businesses that he has been able to sustain himself and take care of his family. High rental, license fees, and high prices of goods are a problem, but he has hopes of becoming a prominent businessman and a model farmer.

He is requesting a loan to buy items like sugar, crates of sodas, cooking oil, and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar, crates of sodas, cooking oil, and others to sell.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a forty-eight-year-old married man with ten children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He sells fish in markets and this is his major source of income. He also has a cocoa garden which gives him more income. He works very hard to look after his big family and has been in this business for fifteen years. He is affected by high competition in the market due to the fact that most people deal in the same business since fish is their staple food. 

He wants the loan to buy fish for resale.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en:
Hosea is a hard-working, honest, and humble man who is 42 years old. He is from the Nandi hills area of Kenya, an area that experiences good weather and supports farming. Hosea has a very beautiful and hard-working wife who takes care of the domestic chores. They have three lovely children they love and adore. 

Hosea was raised in a humble background and never got the opportunity to advance his education.  He did not lose hope. He has farmed for the 16 years. He has been able to take care of his family and provide for their basic needs. 

Hosea loves dairy farming and has nicknames for his cows. Although he makes a profit, not everything has been easy for this industrious man. 

He wants to increase his crop production, so he now seeks a loan to purchase farm implements to boast his crop output and result in more income. He wants to buy good quality seeds and fertilizers. 

Hosea believes that the extra income will change his life and increase his business.

loans.use: To buy farm implements, seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Remedios is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Top Hill Tweyimukye Group

texts.en: Eric is a member of the Top Hill Tweyimukye Group, where each member guarantees the others to get a loan. He sells fresh foods like sweet potatoes, bananas and cassava. He faces the challenge of inadequate capital.  Despite that, he hopes for the construction of a permanent house for his family and to live a good life. Eric needs a loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods like bananas to sell.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo: Es un hombre trabajador, originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 40 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos, en edad escolar. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 15 estableció su taller de soldaduras. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar: tubos galvanizados, decoraciones, y herramientas que utiliza para la elaboración de verjas. Su sueño es establecer una ferretería.
texts.en: Adolfo is a hard-working man originally from Puerto Cabezas. He is 40 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. With the goal of having his own source of income and helping his family get ahead, 15 years ago he established a welding workshop. He seeks his first financing to buy galvanized pipes, decorations and tools to use in making fences. His dream is to establish a hardware store..

loans.use: to buy galvanized pipes, decorations and tools to use in making fences.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor de María: Es una mujer amable, tiene 32 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, que cursan su primaria. Cuenta con una experiencia de más de 5 años de ser docente. Desde hace 14 años vive en una casa de tambo de madera. Solicita su primer financiamiento para cambiar la madera de su casa y comprar: madera, zinc, postes de madera, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y apoyar en el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en: Flor de María is a friendly woman, 32 years old, married, and has 3 children who attend elementary school. She has more than 5 years experience as a teacher. It has been 14 years that she is living in her wooden house. She seeks her first financing to change the wood in her home and buy wood, zinc, wooden posts, nails, and cover the cost of labor. Her dream is to improve the quality of life of her family and support the development of her children.

loans.use: to change the wood of her house.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 47-year-old married man with seven children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He is a cocoa farmer but he also deals in buying and selling of cocoa to make ends meet. He has been in this business since 1990, and it has helped him to pay school fees for his children. 

Andrew wants a loan to buy cocoa for resale.   He hopes to complete his residence and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
A local resident from Kampong Cham province, Sun is 43 years old and a mother of five children. 

Because of her living conditions, she grows rice on a one hectare area. She has been involved in her current business for 30 years and earns her about 10 USD per day. 

For Sun, this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to pay tuition fees for her son who wants to pursue a Bachelor degree, majoring in Information Technology. 

She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son who wants to pursue a Bachelor degree in Information Technology.

loans.name: Ra'nogul

texts.en:
Ra'nogul is from the rural district of Khuroson, where she lives with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Her husband and son now work in the Russian Federation as migrant laborers. 

Ra'nogul is a hard-working woman at the age of 45. She also works for the benefit of the family. Ra'nogul is engaged in cattle breeding. She has been breeding cows and calves for 10 years. She learned this craft from her parents. 

Ra'nogul has already stocked up on cattle feed for the winter. Currently she wants to increase the number of cattle in order to develop her business. With this intention, she asks for a loan to purchase four young calves. 

Ra'nogul hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase four young calves to develop her business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a fifty-nine year old  married woman residing in Mayorga, Leyte. She earns a living by raising and selling hogs.  Together with her husband, they have one grown child. She has been raising hogs for more than 10 years now.

Francisca is in need of capital to finance her hog raising business. She has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy additional piglets and pig feed. This will help Francisca raise and sell more pigs in the coming months. 

Francisca is determined to expand her hog raising business for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
She is Lourdes. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan established her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 8,000 PHP. This new loan will go towards additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Lourdes dreams of expanding her store. She also desires that through all her hard work in business, she will be able to sustain her children's educational needs. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase goods such as potatoes, eggs, and other items she needs in her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 59-year-old, hard-working woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

She fattens cattle as her main source of income.  She started her business she with an intention of generating funds and meeting personal demands. She also practices farming, where she grows coffee to earn extra income. 

Imelda hopes to buy a vehicle to aid her in transporting her products to her customers.  She faces a main challenge of competition and inadequate capital. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cows to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a forty one year old, widowed woman with three children.
