loans.name: Alma Ligia

texts.es:
La señora Alma Ligia, es casada madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales solo dos estan bajo su tutela, labora como comerciante en uno de los mercados de la Ciudad de León desde hace cuatro años, inicia su jornada laborar de 07:00 am finalizando a las 05:00 pm ella realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Doña Alma solicito este crédito a Ceprodel para la  compra de blusas, shores, faldas, camisetas, ropa para bebe, los cuales le beneficiara en el incremento de su capital de trabajo ya que esta próxima la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Alma Ligia is married and the mother of four children, only two of whom are still in her care. She works as a saleswoman in one of the markets in the city of León. She has been in this business for the past four years. She begins her workday at 7 a.m. and finishes at 5 p.m. She does this work in order to sustain her family. 

Alma Ligia requests this loan from Ceprodel to purchase blouses, shorts, skirts, sweaters and baby clothes. This will increase her working capital in preparation for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing items.

loans.name: Sabougnouma 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Sabougnouma 6  sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fonfona, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Ils sont à leur 2ème prêt.
La spéculation cultivée est l’échalote avec Madou Kartié, assis au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels pour exploiter  sa partielle de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Sabougnouma 6 group are married men who on average are 43 years old with four children, all living in traditional families in Fonfona, one of the villages belonging to Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their crop gardening activities, and they are on their second loan.

The selected crop is shallots featuring Madou Kartié, sitting in the middle of the photo. He intends to use his loan to buy seeds, inputs and equipment to exploit his 0.5 hectare (1.24 acres) plot of land.

After harvest the crop will be sold at village level and in Koutiala, to a mixed clientele.

He expects average profits of 110,000 CFA francs by season's end, which will enable him to pay off his loan and cover his daily expenses.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer and equipment

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn is 42, married and blessed with three school going children. She and her husband aspire to improve their status of living and give their children a better life. With this in mind, Rosalyn has been engaging in cooking and selling snack foods within the local community. She wants to prepare more snack recipes to sell but she doesn’t have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 5,000.00 PHP to buy the bananas, sweet potatoes, flour, cooking oil, yeast, sugar and milk she needs to cook and sell her goods. Being a hard working mother, she believes that someday, she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, flour, cooking oil, yeast, sugar and milk

location.town: Brgy. Magsaysay Hill, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marivic hopes that her business will grow bigger. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cipriana works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Cipriana is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Cipriana has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Eam's Group

texts.en:
Eam’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Eam makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 53 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.   

Margarita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Margarita requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her business.

Margarita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Sambat's Group

texts.en:
Sambat’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sambat makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Mom makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller by selling groceries at home to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Chhay's Group

texts.en: Chhay’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chhay makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time on collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado de Mujeres Emprendedoras,  son  de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, y quieren poder ayudar a sus familias.
Leticia es peluquera, y comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre va hasta su negocio para poder recibir su atención. Ella ya es muy conocida en su barrio, y es por eso que le va muy bien.
Leticia pide este préstamo para poder comprar tintes, tijeras, peines, ruleros, cremas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group is called Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women), from the city of San Ignacio. They are united and supportive of each other, work together in their businesses, and want to be able to help their families. 

Leticia is a hairdresser and says that she has a good client base that always goes to her store to be able to receive her attention. She's already very well-known in her neighborhood, which is why her business does well. Leticia is asking for a loan to be able to buy dyes, scissors, combs, hair rollers, etc, to be able to continue her work like he has been doing. 

Everyone is grateful for the opportunity they're receiving to be able to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy dyes, scissors, combs, hair rollers, creams, etc.

loans.name: Latofatkhon

texts.en: Latofatkhon is widowed and the very devoted mother of two grown children. Five years ago, she went into the business of buying and selling children's clothing. Her business developed little by little as she increased her working capital. Now, she has her own shop where she sells perfumes, gifts, and other items. Latofatkhon is a very hardworking woman and a repeat client of IMON with a good credit history. After using previous loans to improve her business, she is requesting a new loan for 6,000 somoni to buy more gifts to sell. She wants to thank Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, bread, canned goods, etc., for her general store business.

Gloria has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from a bakeshop.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, bread, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Resmiye

texts.en:
Resmiye is married with four children. To contribute to the household and her children’s education, she opened a store with a machine to do embroidery and crocheting. 

Now she has five machines and her store has moved to a bigger location. With the loan, she will buy fabric and crocheting materials. She wants to continue her work.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Resmiye Hanım evli dört çocuk annesi.  Evine katkı sağlamak çocuklarını okutmak için evde başladığı piko ve nakış işine bir makina ile dükkan açarak ilerletmiş.  Bugün beş makinası var.  Dükkanını daha büyük bir yere taşıdı.  Aldığı kredi ile kumaş ve piko malzemeleri alacak.  Çocuklarını okutmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy fabric and crocheting materials

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 29 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

Marivic has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en:
Aynur is divorced and the mother of one daughter. She’s retired but she sells jewelry that she makes during the winter from a stall in summer for extra income.She makes the jewelry in winter and also sells it to her friends and neighbors.

With her second loan she’ll buy materials wholesale. She wants to open a store but likes the flexibility of selling this way.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Aynur Hanım eşinden boşanmış  bir kız annesi.  Kendisi emekli ama ek gelir elde edebilmek için kışın hazırladığı takıları yazın  sahilde tezgah açarak satıyor.  Kışın ise hem yapıyor hem de çevresine sürekli  müşterilerine satış yapıyor.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile de toplu takı malzemeleri alacak .  Kendine bir dükkan açmak istiyor ama bu şekilde satış yapmanın da özgürlüğünü kısıtlamadığı için memnun.

loans.use: to buy materials to make jewelry to sell

loans.name: Sokh's Group

texts.en: Sokh’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokh makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a village coordinator to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time on collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Thean's Group

texts.en: Thean’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Thean makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time on collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khursand

texts.en:
This is Khursand. Her name means joy, and by nature she is a cheerful and friendly woman. Khursand lives in Khuroson district with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and grandchildren. Her husband is a pensioner, her son is a businessman and her daughter-in-law is a teacher.

Khursand is a dressmaker by profession. She is 61 years old. Khursand has been providing sewing services for more than seven years. She enjoys her business because she likes to sew. Now Khursand has applied for a loan. She is going to buy a new, modernized sewing machine to expand her business. This loan is important to her.

loans.use: to purchase a modernized sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, and iron.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is 60 years old, widowed, and works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell charcoal.  Letty is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Letty has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Geoffrey, 25, who is based in the Litein area of Kenya. This area may be the major 'bread basket' of the country, but it is increasingly emerging as an important dairy farming zone for the East Africa. Thousands of farmers are now finding dairy farming a good supplement, if not a substitute, for maize.

This father of three has been practicing mixed farming for the past four years and his primary source of income has been milk and eggs. He passionately loves dairy farming and he enjoys feeding “Seroy” (the name of his cow). Milking his cow is his hobby. Waking up every morning to milk his cow is very fulfilling to him. 

The biggest challenge he faces is the lack of a proper dairy unit where his cows can feed and rest. Because of this, he has suffered losses through diseases that attack his cows because of the harsh weather conditions. If you are to reap more from cows, you must feed them properly to get high quality milk. 

He is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to build a modern dairy unit. With the loan, he will be able to increase his milk production, improve his living conditions, and secure the future of his school-going children.

loans.use: To buld a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Nazli

texts.en:
Nazlı is married with one child and is a retired teacher. Since retiring, she has sold handiwork materials from a shop. She also embroiders towels, linen and handkerchiefs to sell. She also makes and sells traditional jewelry. In summer, she operates a stall and sells the products she makes there. With her second loan, she will buy materials and increase the variety of her products. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nazlı  hanım evli bir çocuk annesi emekli öğretmen .  Emekli oldukdan sonra kendine elişi malzemelerinin satıldığı bir tuhafiye dükkanı açmış.  Kendi de aynı zamanda havlu ,keten bezinden örtüler,fular kenarlarına oyalar yapıp satıyor.  Aynı zaman da otantik takılar da yapıp satıyor.  Yazın sahilde tezgah açıyor ve burada da yaptığı ürünleri satışa sunuyor.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile  tekrardan malzeme alacak.  Ürün çeşidini arttıracak.

loans.use: to buy materials for her handiwork

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is 45 years old and married with four children.

Severina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Severina has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns income from a cafeteria.

Severina aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies such as cement, iron, steel, sand, cement, and gravel to build other rooms and a large bathroom.

loans.name: Melek

texts.en: Melek began selling underwear that she bought wholesale with the money she had when she needed to work. She sold the merchandise and used what she earned to buy more items to sell. As her work developed, she opened a stand in the city market. After selling at the market for a few years, she opened a shop. She has run the business for eight years now. With the loan she will buy things for the store. She likes her work a lot and enjoys meeting a lot of people. She plans to work as long as she is healthy.

loans.use: to buy things for her store.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 46 years old, very passionate and diligent about farming. He is considered a pacesetter when it comes to farming in his village of Kipsigak in the Nandihills area of Kenya. Having done mixed farming for the past 15 years, he has gained much experience and he offers free extension services to young upcoming farmers. He is happily married and is blessed with four lovely school-going children. 

Thomas enjoys generating income from selling milk, his harvest, and produce from his farm. He finds dairy farming very fulfilling, but the main challenge he faces is not being able to properly feed his dairy cows. He is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter. Through the loan he will be able to cut hay into small pieces before mixing it with other forage to feed his cattle. The chaff cutter will aid his cattle in digestion and will prevent his dairy cattle from rejecting any part of their food. Proper feeding of your cattle is one of the most important factors in maintaining high yield production of milk. Through proper feeding, his cow will produce more milk and this will translate to more profits and improved living standards. 

When he was asked how this loan will benefit his family, Thomas said “more income”. Profits from the loan will be used in fully repaying the loan and improving the standard of living for his parents, family, and his school-going children.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter to cut hay that can be used as part of cattle feed.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 21-year-old single man who has been running his own scrap business for eighteen months. He had to quit school during his intermediate stages and begin working to support his parents with his income. He is a hard worker, well known in his region with his good reputation and special talents in his domain.

At the beginning, he didn't have a good amount of capital to start his own business, but today, he is managing to increase his capital properly. For this reason, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to improve his business by increasing his merchandise with a wide quantity of scrap that will increase his income and improve his standard of living. He hopes to stay capable of increasing his business capital in a well-managed way.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of scrap for his business

loans.name: Bo's Group

texts.en: Bo’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Bo makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each man and woman to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Bobirjon

texts.en:
Bobirjon is an entrepreneurial person who is married and has a young son. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than six years. Little by little, with the passing of time, he has perfected his knowledge. Thanks to the animals' good condition, he has managed to win a large quantity of customers for his business.

Bobirjon is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way he will be able to offer his customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing his household with good earnings. He awaits your mercy and in advance thanks Kiva lenders for your generosity.

loans.use: to buy young cattle.

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.en:
Gulizor is divorced and has a child. She is a highly educated woman. 

Gulizor works in a school as a teacher of the smaller grades. She has worked there for quite some years. Gulizor is one of the best teachers and her pupils like her classes very much. 

Gulizor has a small salary which is not enough for living. She is going to buy a milk cow and sell milk and milk products to local people. Gulizor hopes to find a new source of income and to improve her living conditions. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy a milk cow. 

She awaits your mercy. 

This loan will help a single mother to offer a good standard of living to her child.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Rafael  está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante, son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La Sra. Aurelia es empleada y también hace otros trabajos, como la venta de remedios naturales, y comenta que pide este préstamo para la compra de remedios naturales para poder seguir con sus ventas y de esa forma poder tener mejores ingresos para ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Ella está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante con sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en:
The group, San Rafael, is in the fourth season of their program for a committee of women, where they all work and help themselves to move forward. These women are the heads of their families who want to give to their loved ones everything they couldn't have. 

Aurelia is employed in several jobs, one of which is selling natural remedies, and she says that she's requesting this loan to buy natural remedies to be able to continue with her sales, so she'll be able to generate more income in order to help her loved ones. She is very grateful for the opportunity she's receiving to be able to grow and move forward with her groupmates.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines for sale

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 42 years old and married. She was blessed with four children and they live happily in a rural community. 

To generate income, she runs a small retail store within her community. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to increase her income in order to support the education of her children. She wants to increase her product offerings but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more inventory of grocery items, load wallet (cell phone 'loads') and mineral waters to resell. 

She is hoping that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of grocery items, load wallet and mineral waters to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Magsaysay Hill, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a freshman in AUCA's Economics Department and this is her story:

“Having great potential to study and also a good knowledge of English, I would like to study in AUCA. I am sure that AUCA will give me a lot of opportunities in the future and will help me to achieve my goals. However, my main problem is the expensive cost of education. Of course, the tuition cost proves an exclusive education and creates a favorable atmosphere for students. This problem will be easily solved with a Kiva loan, if I succeed in obtaining one. We are five in my family. My father hasn’t a stable job; he has different professional skills, which help him to earn some money for a living. My mother is a housewife and looks after my younger sibling. My older sister is married and has her own family. She is the person who supported me in entering AUCA and wanted to help with my tuition fee. I am applying for a Kiva loan in order to cover the other part of my tuition.”

loans.use: to pay for part of her higher education tuition fee.

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en: Sopha’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sopha makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each man and woman to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Norlyn

texts.en:
Norlyn engages in raising and selling hogs. She is a 35-year-old married woman and has three children ages 13, 11, and 8 years old. She has been raising hogs for a year now. Her husband's occupation is a laborer.

Norlyn said that she is able to help her husband provide for their needs by raising hogs. Due to capital insufficiency, she has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy materials to construct a pig pen such as cement, nails, and wood, and to purchase a pig. This will provide the pigs a comfortable atmosphere as well as produce more healthy pigs in the coming months.

In the future, Norlyn hopes to have a stable income that will help her to send her three children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a pig pen such as cement, nails, and wood, and to purchase a pig

loans.name: Jose Rudy

texts.es:
José, requiere de más capital para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar maquinaria para preparar el terreno en el que sembrara maíz y pipían, pues ha confirmado que con la oportunidad que le dan los créditos su negocio está teniendo un buen cambio.
Con el financiamiento anterior los cultivos dieron una cosecha abundante, mantiene estabilidad económica y puede dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida. José actualmente ya cultiva una manzana más de maíz con lo que está generando ingresos extras.
texts.en:
José needs more capital to buy fertilizers and to pay for machinery to prepare the land to plant corn and squash.  He has confirmed that with the opportunity that the loans give him, his business is having a good change.

With the previous loan the crops gave an abundant harvest.  He maintains economic stability and can give his family a better style of life.  José currently grows an acre of corn which is generating extra income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for machinery to prepare the land to plant corn and squash.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 27-year-old single Palestinian refugee, who has been working as a tutor for seven years to provide for his family. He is the sole earner of seven family members.

Mahmoud is a hard working man; he finished his university studies as communication engineer, but unfortunately and since he is Palestinian, he can't work in his field of study. That's why he is investing his education in teaching Math and Physics, in which he is very talented.

Today, since his income is barely enough to cover his family's increasing living needs, Mahmoud is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to make necessary repairs to his home's floor to keep it a healthy living place for his beloved family, and to build an extra room to provide his family a free space.

Mahmoud hopes that one day he can work in his area of expertise. Until then, he is working hard to increase the number of his students to start his special tutoring center in the future.

loans.use: to make necessary repairs to his home.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne has a taxi transport business in Nairobi town and has been in the business for three years now. She is 38 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with three children. 

Carolyne will use this loan to buy vehicle spare parts and to replace the worn out parts of her taxi. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her third loan from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to service her taxi.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre de 43 años de edad, casado, tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 17, 15 y 10 años de edad, y su negocio es la producción de Queso artesanal.
Él es buen padre, sincero, emprendedor, activo, constante y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Karapata’ ubicada en cercanías del lago Titicaca el clima del lugar es extremo, con grandes variaciones de temperatura entre el día y la noche los días son soleados, las lluvias muy raras y la temperatura diurna alcanza los 25° Centígrados, Las noches son siempre frías.
Mario es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar, para el comercio en la ciudad habla español. su vida la realiza en compañía de su esposa que se dedica a la agricultura y sus cuatro hijos; el mayor se encuentra estudiando una carrera técnica y los tres menores estudian en la escuela y también trabajan en la agricultura. Toda la familia vive en una casa de adobe que cuenta con electricidad y agua potable. Su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal; la variedad de quesos más producida y consumida en la zona, es el queso fresco, que en términos prácticos, se pueden dividir entre crudos y cocidos, en donde podemos encontrar para el primero la cuajada campesina, obtenida de la pasteurización de la leche, obtención de la cuajada y su posterior salado y moldeado; o el quesillo o el queso doble crema, para el segundo caso, que después de la obtención de la cuajada, pasa a cocción, que puede ser en una semiesfera de acero o “paila”, donde la cuajada se cuece en seco, hervida en agua o suero de leche, según la clase de elaboración, ‘mi trabajo lleva mucha pasión, buscamos la manera de estar en constante mejoramiento de nuestros procesos…’.  Su sueño es producir para vender a mercados y supermercados de la ciudad, y desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de ganado lechero mejorado, para aumentar la producción lechera y de queso. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en tres años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mario solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para aumentar su producción lechera y de queso.
texts.en:
Mario is 43-years-old and married with 4 children (ages 19, 17, 15, and 10).  He is in the business of artisanal cheese production.  He is a good father and an active, honest, enterprising, perseverant, and hard-working man.  He carries out his business in the community of Karapata located close to Lake Titicaca.  This area has an extreme climate characterized by large variations in temperature between days and nights.  It is sunny during the daytime with  temperatures reaching 25ºC (77º F), and it rarely rains.  The nights are always cold.

Mario is short-statured with a dark complexion and short black hair.  His mother tongue is Aymará, which is spoken in this area.  He speaks Spanish when doing business in the city.  He lives his life accompanied by his wife who is dedicated to farming and raising their four children.  The oldest child is working towards a technical degree and the three younger children go to school as well as working on the farm.  The whole family lives in an adobe house with electricity and running water.  

Mario is in the business of artisanal cheese production. The variety of cheese which is most produced and consumed in the area is known as "queso fresco", or "fresh cheese".  In practical terms, it can be divided into raw and cooked varieties, which are made from country-style curds created by the pasteurization process which are salted and moulded.  He also makes "quesillo" ("farmer's cheese") and "double cream cheese", which in the case of the latter is cooked after obtaining the curds and formed into a hemisphere of wax or "paila".  The curds are either dry-cooked, or boiled in water or buttermilk, according to the type of production.

Mario comments that he is passionate about his work and that he is always looking for ways to improve the cheese-making process.  His dream is to produce cheese to sell in markets and supermarkets in the city, and he wants to expand his business by buying better milk cows to increase his production of milk and cheese.  This is his first sequence of loans with this institution in the three years that he has been in this business.  For the aforementioned reasons, Mario is asking for a loan to buy milk cows in order to increase his production of milk and cheese.

loans.use: to buy milk cows to augment his production of milk and cheese

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits to sell and groceries like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, condiments, sugar, coffee and beverages.

loans.name: Choy's Group

texts.en: Choy’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Choy makes a living cultivating rice and planting watermelons and she also does extra work as a village coordinator to support her family. In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hik's Group

texts.en: Hik’s groups live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Hik makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and tailor. In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.en:
Rahimjon is married and has a child for whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that, two years ago, he began his own business with driving. Thanks to the good service he provides, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving. 

Rahimjon is asking for a loan to repair his car. As a result, his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and he will be able to increase his income, which will allow him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en: Thorn’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Thorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and motor driver to support her family. In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 40-year-old mother with four children who attend school. Despite life's hardships, she and husband want to educate their children and give them better lives. Luzviminda  runs a small retail store in their community to supplement her husband's income. 

Luzviminda wants to further improve her business but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks of beverages, canned goods, seasonings, snack foods, noodles, fruits and vegetables to sell. With this financial assistance, she believes that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of beverages, canned goods, seasonings, snack foods, noodles, fruits and vegetables to sell

location.town: Brgy. Almaguer North, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marietta sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies needed for her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenses.

She is very positive that she could improve her business further if you will let her borrow again an amount of 40,000 PHP. This new loan will go towards the purchase of additional products like bananas, charcoal and other items which she resells. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Marietta wants to expand the business so that she will be able to help support the educational needs of her grandchildren. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional products, such as  bananas, charcoal and other supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: Chantha’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chantha makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In the group's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Sreymom’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreymom makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, age 66, lives in Chuka, which is a small agricultural center in Central Kenya. He is a husband and a father of six children. James started a mixed farm in 1990, and continues to farm for a living. His primary income sources are eggs, milk and crops. James enjoys sheep farming and dairy farming above all other activities. The main challenges he faces with this type of farming are disease outbreaks and expensive dairy feed.

James is seeking a loan to purchase dairy goats. To him, raising goats is an enjoyable and lucrative farming experience. He understands the challenges that come with goat farming and the market uncertainties. This knowledge has influenced his strategic plans to incorporate a few measures beforehand. He plans to use the income from this investment to repay the loan and to pay for his children’s education. When he was asked how the loan would benefit his family, he said, “I will be able to educate my children and also feed my family.”

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats to raise.

loans.name: Zehnsho

texts.en:
As a married parent of a child, Zehnsho works hard to support his family. He has had a fruit sales business in Tajikistan for 20 years. He has a store in a local market where he mainly sells lemons. Zehnsho works hard every day and hopes to improve his business in order to provide good living conditions for his family in future. 

Zehnsho is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to increase his working capital so he can buy lemons. He is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to increase his income so he can make some improvements to his house. In this way, his house will be safer and his family's standard of living will improve. Zehnsho will continue working and fighting to make his biggest dream come true: “to be successful in life”.

loans.use: to increase his working capital so he can buy lemons

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ines ella es conviviente y tiene 34 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes , la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ganados, negocio de venta de fruta, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to a communal bank called "Las Emprendedoras de Andahuaylillas" (The Entrepeneurs of Andahuaylillas). This bank is located in Andahuaylillas, in the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco. 

One members is Ines, 34, who has a live-in partner and two children. She works in a grocery store that she owns, selling basic foods such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. Ines works from 8am to 6pm, and after 5 years her store has been doing very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She's requesting this loan in order to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice. 

Other members make their living in businesses selling cattle, selling fruit, grocery stores, and restaurants. 

Ines is grateful for those who form a part of this dream through this medium and promises to keep up with the payment of her fees in the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
This nice woman in the photo is Shushanik from Mrgashat village, Armavir region. On her small and beautiful farm, Shushanik keeps a cow, pig and 20 hens, and she cultivates tomatoes as well. Shushanik lives with her husband and 9-year-old daughter. Her husband is unemployed and his main occupation is agriculture.  

Realizing how important agricultural income is for the family, Shushanik wants to increase this income. She asks for financial support to be able to purchase an ox, forage (150 packages) and ten packages of fertilizer. This is a very important investment for her farm, which will give her an opportunity to be prepared for the winter season. 

Shushanik will be very grateful to lenders if they support her loan to be funded.

loans.use: to pay for an ox, forage (150 packages) and ten packages of fertilizer.

loans.name: Phoeurn's Group

texts.en: Phoeurn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Phoeurn makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and he also does extra work as a construction worker to support his family. In the group's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of this man and these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
