loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: France Group

texts.en:
Leonia, who is in her early 40s, is married with five children who are still in school. She has been running a poultry business for seven years now.  She works from 6.30 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Leonia's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy chicks and chicken feeds and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to also buy chicks and chicken feeds.  She dreams of adding two rooms on her house.

Leonia will share this loan with her loan group, "France," which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to  buy chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.en:
Huseyn was born in 1981. He is married and has two children. His children are little. He is the main provider for his family, as his wife is a housewife. Huseyn’s parents are also living with him. 

Huseyn works hard every day to provide his big family with all the necessary things. Huseyn has his own business. He has a shop where he sells dishes and other products. Huseyn has worked in this field more than three years, and he little by little has improved his business. 

He is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy dishes for increasing working capital. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy dishes for increasing working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, rice, biscuits and snack foods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his shop like pliers and screwdrivers, a compressor, nut and bolts.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb has a tailoring business which he has been running for close to two years. He designs and makes different kinds of clothes ranging from shirts, blouses and coats to trousers. He is 34 years old, married and, together with his spouse, they have been blessed with two children: one child is aged two and they have a seven-month-old daughter. Caleb also supports his two parents. 

Caleb will use this loan to buy more stocks of textile materials, threads and buttons for use in his tailoring business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This will be his second loan from VisionFund Kenya after he successfully repaid his previous loan. In the future, Caleb hopes to become a successful businessman and also to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of textile materials, threads and buttons for use in his tailoring business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Her name is Janet, 37, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Ricky, a painter, and has three children who are all in high school. She works hard to augment their income and meet her family's daily personal and household needs, as well as the schooling of her children.

Janet has a backyard piggery farm and has been a hog raiser for five years already. Investing in a piggery is a good and profitable business as female pigs conceive twice in a year and can produce as much as 12 piglets each time. 

To help her continue operations of her business she is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan which she will use to buy more piglets, and feed and medicines for her pigs. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her. It will be a big help to support her children's education and cover their daily needs.

Janet aims to diversify so that her income from business will improve. She wants to give her children the best education until college to ensure them of a good future. She prays for a happy family and a quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies

. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for piglets, feed and medicines for her piggery business.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 20-year-old single lady who has been working as a tutor for four years, when she had to work hard to pay for her university tuition fees.

She is well known in the region with her special teaching talents. Her income is good enough to cover her living needs, and the living expenses of two other members of her family. Unfortunately, she can't cover increasing unexpected expenses. Thus, for this reason, her acquired Al Majmoua / Kiva loan will be invested in paying for a necessary medical surgery she has to undergo urgently.

She hopes that in the future she can open her own laboratory and work in her university degree.

loans.use: to undergo necessary medical surgery she has to have urgently.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard has a cake vending and supply shop in Tala town and has been running this business for eight years. He is 34 years old, married, and together with his spouse, they have been blessed with one child. 

He will use this loan to buy more stock of bread, scones and cakes for sale and supply to hotels and retail shops. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This is his fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. In the future he hopes to open more cake shops and create employment opportunities to his friends.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, scones and cakes for sale.

loans.name: Sabougnouma 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Sabougnouma 7 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fonfona, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Ils sont à leur 2ème prêt.
La spéculation cultivée est l’échalote avec Abdou, assis au bout vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels pour semer et exploiter sa partielle de 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Sabougnouma 7 group are married men who on average are 42 years old with three children, all living in traditional families in Fonfona, one of the villages belonging to Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their crop gardening activities, and they are on their second loan.

The selected crop is shallots featuring Abdou, sitting at the far left in the photo. He intends to use his loan to buy seeds, inputs and equipment to sow and exploit his 0.25 hectare (0.62 acres) plot of land.

After harvest the crop will be sold at village level and in Koutiala, to a mixed clientele.

He expects average profits of 95,000 CFA francs by end of growing season, which will enable him to pay off his loan and cover his daily expenses.

loans.use: Achat de Semences, engrais et matériels.

loans.name: Marily

texts.en:
Marily is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marily has been in this business for two years. Marily earns more income from fish vending.

Marily has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Dina Elenita

texts.en:
Dina Elenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of goods to sell for her general store business.

Dina Elenita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Dina Elenita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Josephat. He is a 42-year-old farmer from Thuita village, situated in the Central province of Kenya. He lives together with his wife and four children on a small piece of land where he keeps dairy cows and poultry and grows a wide variety of crops. 

For ten years, his primary sources of income have been eggs and horticultural produce. His biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. 

Josephat made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help him improve his farming activities. Sometime last month, he applied for a loan for expanding his horticulture farm. This will enable him to expand his operations to increase the overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to his children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out to start working to contribute their earnings to their families. 

With your loan, Josephat's children will acquire a quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.

loans.use: to expand his horticulture farming.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent a 65-year-old man living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. He is married with seven children and he is very hard working in regard to the cocoa business. Outside of the cocoa business, he has managed to build rentals and start up carpentry work. He has a vision of building a permanent house for his family. He is affected by bad weather. He wants a loan to buy cocoa for selling this peak season.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling during this peak season.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is a single mother and takes care of her two children single-handedly.

She runs a boutique business where she sells second hand clothes and is also an agriculturalist, growing beans, maize and matoke. She works six days in a week and ten hours per day and started the business to develop income, pay school fees for her nephews, and provide food for the family. She acquired the loan to add stock in the business. Her clients are the local residents.

Her hope for the future is to start shopping from China such that she can maximize the profits and build her own home, which will help her to save on the cost of rent. The challenge she faces is that many clients take long to settle their debts. 

She describes herself  as a hardworking woman. She thanks UGAFODE for making it possible for low income earners to access credit.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en: Savy’s group members live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Savy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel to boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chigwirizano Group

texts.en:
Stellia is a 50-year-old widow who supports her children by selling rice in a market of Chikwawa district. She is requesting this loan to purchase more rice in order to reach more customers in her locality. She has five children who go to school, and she also looks after school-going orphans. 

She started her business five years ago and currently, she has one employee who assists her in the day-to-day business operations. With the previous profits made, she has managed to buy livestock such as chickens, and she has been able to improve the living standards for her family. 

Stellia has plans to expand her business, and in the future, with the profits made, she wants to buy a motorcycle and start building a good house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Daniiar

texts.en:
Daniiar is a freshman in AUCA's Economics Department and this is his story:

“In the summer of 2014, I applied for financial aid for AUCA and was told about Kiva. I was surprised with the loan conditions as there isn’t an analog of it in Kyrgyzstan. Unknown people all over the world give money to those who are in need and don't even know them. I thought it was my fortune and now I am applying to Kiva and will be happy to receive your aid.

I am from a middle class family in Bishkek. My father is an engineer, but hasn't worked since 2012, due to his age. My mother is a doctor at the hospital. Public employees have such small salaries in Kyrgyzstan (compared to the west or USA), which covers just daily expenses and utilities. I want to help my parents by having a part-time job, but there are a lot of people with high education who are seeking a job here. That’s why I need a good education, what will cause in future a high pay, good self esteem, and my family will feel proud of me. I think people should get a good education, because that way they can feel more comfortable with their life.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Holy Rose

texts.en:
Holy Rose is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Ormoc, Leyte. Holy Rose is engaged in furniture making with her husband. This has been the source of their income for more than ten years now.

Holy Rose is asking for a loan to buy wood, nails, varnish and paint. This loan will help them make more furniture, which they will sell for a good price.

In the future, Holy Rose hopes of making her business profitable. She also wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, varnish and paint.

loans.name: Siguida Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 8 membres du groupe  Siguida Benkadi 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Koumbri, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Ils sont à leur 2ème prêt.
La spéculation cultivée est le Choux- pomme avec Arouna, arrêté au bout vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels pour semer et exploiter sa partielle de 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 8 members of the Siguida Benkadi 1 group are married men who on average are 41 years old with five children, all living in traditional families in Koumbri, one of the villages belonging to Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their crop gardening activities, and they are on their second loan.

The selected crop is cabbage featuring Arouna, standing at the far left in the photo. He intends to use his loan to buy seeds, inputs and equipment to exploit his 0.25 hectare (0.62 acres) plot of land.

After harvest the crop will be sold at village level and in Koutiala, to a mixed clientele.

He expects average profits of 150,000 CFA francs by end of growing season, which will enable him to pay off his loan and cover his daily expenses.

loans.use: buy seeds, agricultural inputs and equipment

loans.name: Siguida Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 8 membres du groupe  Siguida Benkadi 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Koumbri, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Ils sont à leur 2ème prêt.
La spéculation cultivée est le Choux- pomme avec Drissa, assis au bout vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels pour exploiter sa partielle de 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 8 members of the Siguida Benkadi 2 group are married men who on average are 33 years old with four children, all living in traditional families in Koumbri, one of the villages belonging to Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their crop gardening activities, and they are on their second loan.

The selected crop is cabbage featuring Drissa, sitting at the far left in the photo. He intends to use his loan to buy seeds, inputs and equipment to exploit his 0.25 hectare (0.62 acres) plot of land.

After harvest the crop will be sold at village level and in Koutiala, to a mixed clientele.

He expects average profits of 145,000 CFA francs by end of growing season, which will enable him to pay off his loan and cover his daily expenses.

loans.use: buy seeds, agricultural inputs and equipment

loans.name: Siguida Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 8 membres du groupe  Siguida Benkadi 3 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Koumbri, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Ils sont à leur 2ème prêt.
La spéculation cultivée est le Choux- pomme avec Madou, assis 2ème de la droit vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels pour exploiter sa partielle de 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 155 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 8 members of the Siguida Benkadi 3 group are married men who on average are 35 years old with five children, all living in traditional families in Koumbri, one of the villages belonging to Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their crop gardening activities, and they are on their second loan.

The selected crop is cabbage featuring Madou, the second person sitting from right to left in the photo. He intends to use his loan to buy seeds, inputs and equipment to exploit his 0.25 hectare (0.62 acres) plot of land.

After harvest the crop will be sold at village level and in Koutiala, to a mixed clientele.

He expects average profits of 155,000 CFA francs by end of growing season, which will enable him to pay off his loan and cover his daily expenses.

loans.use: buy seeds, agricultural inputs and equipment

loans.name: Joachim

texts.en:
Joachim is a 58-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge Uganda. He practices cattle fattening and runs a butcher shop as his main source of income alongside farming. He started this business so as to earn a living and improve on his standards of living. He hopes to build a good permanent house; however, his main challenges are price fluctuations and inadequate capital. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening and slaughtering this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as cement, bricks, iron steel, sand, and gravel, for building rooms.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane, a pedagogue (teacher) by profession, has been running a farm for many years. Gayane lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and 7-year-old granddaughter. 

Her son is a furniture maker and has a workshop, which is in the house. Gayane's husband helps her with running a farm and selling gathered products in the market. On the farm they keep cows and three pigs, and cultivate tomatoes, eggplant and peppers. Near the house, Gayane also runs an orchard where she grows 200 trees of plum.
 
To be able to invest in her farm and make it more sustainable, Gayane asks for the loan. She plans to purchase forage for the livestock (one ton of barley) and 20 packs of fertilizer. 

She hopes to receive the loan and make her farm more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock (one ton of barley) and 20 packs of fertilizer

loans.name: Loleta

texts.en:
Loleta is a 64-year-old resident of Intramuros, Philippines. Her husband is Fernando and they have five children. They manage their household while operating the business. At this time, they are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Loleta operates a food stall. She sells breakfast meals, which are combination of rice and typical Filipino viands. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like pork, rice, condiments and seasonings.

Loleta hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She dreams of a happy and long life with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Nueva Union Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nueva Union forma parte del programa de comité de mujeres, y también del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de vida de cada integrante,  y conforme a ello poder trabajar por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Felipa quien ha ido mejorando poco a poco y por medio de su trabajo en la costura-confección, se  destaca el trabajo de esta señora ya que ella es una mujer muy entusiasta, que tiene el deseo de poder mejorar y superarse, todo esto para ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Felipa solicita de este préstamo para la compra  de  telas para hacer sabanas, fundas, edredón y luego vender a los clientes, lo que le ayudará a poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group called Nueva Union is part of Women's Committee program, and also is part of the poverty elimination program, which allows them the ability to see each member's standard of living and work to improve it accordingly. One of the members is Felipa, who little by little has improved her situation by working in sewing and garment making, all to help her family and loved ones.

Felipa is requesting this loan to purchase fabric to make sheets, pillow cases, and quilts to sell to the customers, which will allow her to continue with her job.

loans.use: To purchase fabric for making sheets, pillow cases, and quilts to sell

loans.name: Rosaura Isabel

texts.es:
Rosaura, logro tener una buena cosecha,  aumento los animales de corral, sus ingresos nuevos le dan oportunidad de cambiar el estilo de vida familiar y cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito por los buenos resultados y la necesidad de contar con recursos económicos para comprar concentrado para cerdos y aves de corral, de esta manera estarán en óptimas condiciones para venderlos en la época navideña, espera que sus ganancias sean mayores y pueda cancelar su deuda.
texts.en: Rausaura managed to collect a good harvest and grow her livestock. Her new incomes give her the opportunity to change her family's lifestyle and keep up with the payment of her fees. She decided to ask for a new loan because of her good results and the necessity of taking into account the economic resources needed to buy pig and bird feed, so they will be in the best condition to be sold during the Christmas season. She hopes that her profits will be better and that she can cancel her debt.

loans.use: to buy pig and bird feed, so they will be in the best condition to be sold during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Robethly

texts.en:
Robethly is a married woman residing in Mayorga, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities like cooking oil, sugar, soap, noodles, eggs, sugar and seasonings. She is  28 years old and has two children, ages 2 and 6 months old, respectively. Her husband's occupation is a welder. 

She is in need of additional capital to finance her current business, and she is also eager to start raising hogs. She definitely has a lack of capital for pursuing such endeavor.

Robethly has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional stock for the store and to purchase pigs and pig feed. In this way, she can fill her store with stock and can attract more customers. This could create higher earnings.

In the future, Robethly dreams of managing her business to be successful and also to provide for the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store and purchase pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in: pants, blouses, skirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Announciata

texts.en:
Announciata is a 38-year-old, hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a drug shop as her main source of income. She started this business with an intention of educating her children and improving her standards of living. She also earns extra income from brewing the local brew (malwa). 

She hopes to be a prominent businesswoman and buy a motor vehicle for easy transport. Her main challenge is inadequate capital, high license fees and price fluctuations. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more tablets and syrups to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more tablets and syrups to boost her business.

loans.name: Evelin Yamileth

texts.es:
Evelyn, es una persona que desempeña diferentes actividades para obtener recursos económicos, las cuales son venta de pupusas, refrescos, cosméticos y otros productos de revista, el oficio lo aprendió de su madre, iniciando a trabajar por su propia cuenta hace 6 años, pero solo con la venta de pupusas, con las ganancias pudo incluir la venta de productos de revista para incrementar sus ingresos; está dedica a cuidar de sus dos hijos, es casada, su familia la apoya en su negocio.
Invertirá en tomates, repollo, gas propano, harina, quesillo, etc., para elaborar la venta de pupusas, con el resto podrá comprar lociones, cosméticos y otros productos de revista, fortalecerá su negocio para la temporada navideña y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
Sus sueños son dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida, mantener su negocio activo y cancelar la deuda con buena calificación.
texts.en: Evelyn is a person that carries out different activities to earn income, namely selling pupusas, soft drinks, cosmetics, and other magazine products. She learned the job from her mother, starting to work on her own 6 years ago with just pupusa sales. With the profits earned she was able to include selling magazine products in her business to boost her income; she uses this income to care for her two children, is married, and her family helps her with the business. She will invest in tomatoes, cabbage, propane gas, flour, cheese, etc to sell pupusas and with the rest she'll buy lotions, cosmetics, and other magazine products. She'll reinforce her business ahead of the Christmas season and that way have more income. Her dreams are to give her family a better standard of living, keep her business going, and pay off the debt with high marks.

loans.use: To invest in tomatoes, cabbage, propane gas, flour, cheese, etc to sell pupusas and magazine products.

loans.name: Chrep's Group

texts.en:
Chrep’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chrep makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Primo

texts.en:
Primo is an industrious man residing in the town of Dulag, Leyte. He engages in making peanut butter and homemade burgers. 

He is a 50-year-old married man and has two children, ages 16 and 14 years old. 

He has been in the food-vending business for almost 11 years. Primo is standing in front of his coconut grater machine and beside him is the machine he uses for grinding peanuts.

Primo has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy supplies like ground peanuts, margarine, salt, meat and many others. This will help him produce more peanut butter stock and also increase his burger making as well.

In the future, Primo  would like to expand his  business to be successful and hopefully finance the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy supplies like ground peanuts, margarine, salt, meat and many others

loans.name: Daoula Group

texts.fr: Angèle, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Les enfants d'Angèle ont tous fait l'école mais présentement tous 2 font le commerce. Cela fait 10 ans qu'Angèle fait le commerce des pagnes traditionnels burkinabés. Cette femme dynamique a besoin de se prêt pour rénover sa boutique. Elle aimerait présenté plusieurs modèles et qualités de pagnes traditionnels à sa clientèle donc ce prêt l'aidera à réaliser ce vœux. Le bénéfice lui permettra de continuer son activité.
texts.en: Angèle, the group's representative, is married and the mother of two children. Angèle's children have attended school but are currently both working. Angèle has been selling traditional burkinabé pagnes [traditional fabric] for 10 years. This dynamic woman needs this loan to renovate her shop. She would like to display several different types and qualities of traditional pagnes for her customers, and this loan will help her realize this wish. The profits will allow her to continue her business.

loans.use: To purchase traditional burkinabé pagne fabric to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a dairy unit

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a farmer who engages in growing and selling rice, corn and root crops. She is married and has three children who are 16, 13 and 8 years old. She has been farming for more than 20 years. She is standing in front of the newly harvested rice, ready to be milled.

Arlene has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, insecticide and medicine. This will help to improve her yield and produce a bigger harvest.

Arlene hopes to have a stable income to help send her children to school for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide and medicine

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia compuesta por su esposa y un hijo de 4 años, ambos se esfuerzan por minimizar las necesidades de su hogar; José por motivación propia hace tres años estableció una granja de pollos y práctica la crianza de cerdos, no tiene un horario establecido para realizar el trabajo.
Comprará cerdos y pollos de engorde, le permitirá aumentar la productividad de su negocio para época de verano, su objetivo es mantenerse trabajando para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y pagar con buena calificación crediticia su deuda.
Sus proyectos son ahorrar para comprar una propiedad y mejorar la que ya posee.
texts.en:
José lives with his family, which is made up of his wife and a son who is 4 years old. He and his wife work hard to meet the needs of their household. José started his own chicken farm three years ago and he also raises pigs. He doesn't have an established schedule for doing his work.

He will buy pigs and chickens for fattening. This will allow him to increase the productivity of his business for the summer season. His goal is to keep working so he can give his family a better quality of life and pay his loan so he can have good credit qualifications. 

His goals are to save for a piece of property and to improve what he already has.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens for fattening, which will allow him to increase the productivity of his business for the summer season.

loans.name: Benkadi 11 Group

texts.fr:
Yeri est une femme battante qui mariée et son mari fait le jardinage. Elle a 5 enfants dont 4 continuent l’école et un fait la couture.
Elle est la responsable du groupe Benkadi 11 et vend de la farine du maïs depuis 4 ans. Etant donnée qu'au Burkina Faso, c'est la période des récoltes, ce prêt lui permettrait d’acheter 5 sacs de maïs à bon prix qu'elle transformera en farine pour vendre. Le commerce de Yeri est rentable puisque la farine est beaucoup utiliser pour faire le to l'un des repas principal des burkinabés.Avec le bénéfice de ses ventes, elle aimerait accroître son activité et s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yeri is a strong woman who is married; her husband is a gardener. She has five children, four of whom are still in school and one of whom is a seamstress.

Yeri is the leader of Benkadi 11 Group and has been selling corn flour for four years. Since it's harvest time in Burkina Faso, this loan will allow Yeri to purchase five sacks of corn at a good price, which she will turn into flour to sell. Yeri's business is profitable because [corn] flour is used a lot to make tô, a principal burkinabé meal. With the profits from her sales, she would like to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of corn to stock to make [corn] flour to sell.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en: Rahim is a farmer and he is 30 years old. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Füzuli city and now Rahim lives with his family in Füzuli region. He is single. Rahim has raised cows for 6 years. He buys little calves, raises them and sells them in the local bazaar. Today, Rahim wants to buy two calves for his farm. For this reason, he needs 1350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) and therefore he has applied to Komak Credit Union for a loan. He says that he is thankful to Kiva for the help. In the future, he wishes to develop his business, increase his income and to get married.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Hương is 34 years old and she is married with 3 children. Hương lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hương has a manufacturing business making wood furniture. In 2013, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Hương hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Tursun

texts.en:
Tursun comes from a rural area. He was born in 1962. Tursun is married and has 2 children. His children are adults and they help him to feed cattle. Tursun has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 30 years. He has great experience in this field. 

Tursun has worked hard since childhood because his father died when he was young and he helped his mother to earn a living. So, Tursun has worked hard every day since childhood. He has a big cowshed where he feeds cattle. The main source of the family income is from animal husbandry and that’s why they live poorly. 

Now, Tursun must buy coal and wood for winter, but he has not money. The weather is cold in winter and he really needs the financial support of lenders. He is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy coal and wood for winter. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy coal and wood for the winter

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, se dedica a vender tortillas como una forma de poder tener ingresos económicos con los que pueda aportar en los gastos familiares, vive con su  esposo y dos hijos, cuenta que no tiene familiares en el extranjero; el negocio lo tiene desde hace 6 meses, trabaja sola y en ocasiones paga a otra persona que le ayude, esto según  sea la demanda, trabaja de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde, el oficio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia.
Será de mucha utilidad para comprar maíz, leña, gas propano, una cocina nueva y una mesa, equipara su negocio para que tenga una imagen más presentable y contara con los materiales principales para elaborar su venta, espera tener un aumento en la productividad y en sus ganancias, las dificultades son que el negocio está ubicado en una zona donde existe mucha delincuencia. 
Sus sueños son comprar su casa propia y mantener su negocio creciendo.
texts.en:
María sells tortilla as a way of having some economic income with which she can contribute to the family's expenses. She lives with her husband and two children. She explains that she doesn't have any family members living in other countries. She has had her business for 6 months. She works alone but sometimes pay another person to help her, according to demand. She works from 6:00 in the morning until 2:00 in the afternoon. She learned this profession through her own intiative.

It will be very useful to her to buy corn, firewood, propane gas, a new stove and a table. She will equip her business so that it will look more presentable and so she will have the ingredients she needs to make her product. She hopes to increase her productivity and her earnings. A difficulty for her business is that it's located in an area where there's a lot of crime. 

Her dreams are to buy her own house and to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, propane gas, a new stove and a table so she can equip her business so that it will look more presentable.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
For the last 10 years Teresia has been selling fast foods for a living and earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is married to Maurice and blessed with three school-going children.

She has applied for this first loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to buy more foodstuffs like rice, wheat flour and cooking oil.
 
Teresia will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs and also plough back into the business. She hopes to grow her business and build a good house for the family.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs like rice, wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Tơ

texts.en:
Tơ is 37 years old and she is married with 2 children. Tơ lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Tơ has a service business tailoring clothes. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tơ has been involved in this business for 3 years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tơ hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Entraide 3 Group

texts.fr: Entraide 3 un groupe de 5 femmes qui travaillent avec ACFIME depuis Septembre 2013. Ce groupe n'a pas de difficulté a honoré ses engagements concernant les remboursements. Clémentine, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle fait le commerce des pagnes et des chaussures. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter plus de pagnes et de chaussures pour sa boutique surtout que bientôt c'est les fêtes de noël et de fin d'année. le bénéfice que généra ses ventes lui permettra de faire face à quelques dépenses de sa famille et renforcer son commerce.
texts.en: Entraide 3 Group is a group of five women who have been working with ACFIME since September 2013. This group has no trouble honoring its commitments in terms of repayments. Clémentine, the group's representative, is married and the mother of three children, all of them in school. She sells pagnes [traditional fabric] and shoes. With this loan, she plans to purchase more pagnes and shoes for her shop, especially since the holidays - Christmas and the New Year - are coming. The profits generated by her sales will allow Clémentine to meet several family expenses and strengthen her business.

loans.use: To purchase pagnes [traditional fabric] and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 28-year-old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a boutique as his main source of income, a business he started because it was profitable. He also earns extra income from being a secondary teacher. He hopes to increase his profits and later buy a vehicle to take him to the markets, however, the main challenge he faces is inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Hà is 29 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hà operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hà has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main hardship that Hà faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her children to do well in school, to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Mawoukoegna

texts.fr: MAWOUKOEGNA, âgée de 44 ans, vit à Lomé dans le quartier Djifa-Kpota ; elle est veuve et a trois enfants. Elle est commerçante de cure dent depuis 1999 et vend de manière ambulante dans les environs. ; elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois ; pour cela MAWOUKOEGNA désire avoir un soutien financier pour accroitre son activité génératrice de revenu pour aider son foyer à mieux s’en sortir dans les dépenses quotidiennes et maximiser de profits.
texts.en: Mawoukoegna is 44 years old and lives in Lomé in the Djifa-Kpota neighborhood; she is a widow and has three children. Mawoukoegna has been selling toothpicks since 1999 and sells door-to-door in the surrounding area; she gets her supplies once per month. She wants to have financial support in order to expand her business to help her household better meet the day-to-day expenses and maximize her profits.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of toothpicks.

loans.name: Carlos Efrain

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 35 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es el comercio de ganado.
Él es independiente, responsable, constante, activo, paciente y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Batallas’ un área caracterizada porque se encuentra en la parte oeste del lago Titicaca y el Puerto Pérez, se encuentra a una altitud promedio de 3900 metros sobre el nivel del mar, tiene un pronunciado clima diurno en donde las variaciones de temperatura durante el día son más pronunciados a medida que avanza el año. La temperatura media anual en la región es de 8,8 ° centígrados, las temperaturas medias mensuales varían muy poco entre los 6 ° centígrados en julio y 10 ° centígrados en noviembre / diciembre. 
Carlos es de tez morena, estatura alta, cabello negro corto rizado, su lengua materna es el aymara que se habla en el lugar para el comercio en la ciudad habla español. Su vida la realiza en casa de su madre la cual se dedica a la agricultura, viven en una casa de adobe que cuenta con electricidad y agua potable. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado; el hato promedio que comercia , oscila su número entre 2-5 cabezas de ganado vacuno, 15-20 ovinos, 2-5 cerdos, 2-8 aves, 2-3 camélidos y 7-15 cuyes. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desea realizar una inversión en el comercio de ganado lechero, realizando la compra de ganado mejorado. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en quince años que viene realizando esta labor.
Es por esos motivos que Carlos solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado mejorado para ampliar su granja.
texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old. He is single and doesn't have children. His business is selling livestock. 

He is independent, responsible, consistent, active, patient, and hardworking. He carries out his work in the town of Batallas, an area known for for its location on the west side of Lake Titicaca and Port Pérez. It's located at an average altitude of 3,900 meters above sea level. It has a pronounced daily climate in which the temperature variations during the day are more pronounced farther along in the year. The average anual temperature in the region is 8.8 degrees centigrade. The monthly average temperatures vary little, between 6 degrees centigrade in July and 10 degrees centigrade in November/December.

Carlos dark, tall, and has black wavy hair. His first language is Aymara, which is spoken in the town. For puposes of commerce in the city, Spanish is spoken. He lives in his mother's house; she works in agriculture. They live in an adobe house that has electricity and running water. His business is buying and selling livestock. His average herd size varies from 2-5 cattle, 15-20 sheep, 2-5 pigs, 2-8 domestic fowl, 2-3 camelids, and 7-15 guinea pigs. His dream is to improve his family's quality of life and he wants to invest in dairy cattle by purchasing improved dairy breeds. This is the first loan with this institution in the fifteen years he has been doing this work.

Carlos is requesting a loan to buy improved breed dairy cattle to expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy improved breed dairy cattle to expand his farm.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús, es parte de una familia integrada por su compañero de vida y tres hijos, ella es una persona que se dedica a luchar por dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, hace 4 años inicio a vender variedad de bebidas poco a poco ha ido fortaleciendo su negocio, actualmente ya tiene venta de  pupusas y una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, aprendió el oficio de su madre, su horario es de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar golosinas, huevos, harina, cereales, granos básicos, bebidas, etc., así su negocio seguirá mejorando, espera ofrecer diversidad de productos a sus clientes  y mantener la venta de pupusas, tiene como ventaja la ubicación del negocio en una zona muy concurrida.
Aspira a tener mejores ingresos para ir creciendo como comerciante y tener mayores ganancias las que le servirán para cancelar sus deudas y cambiar el nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Jesús is part of a family made up of her partner and three children. She is a person who is dedicated to fighting to give her family better living conditions. Four years ago she started selling a variety of soft drinks. Bit by bit she has strengthened her business. She now sells pupusas [thick tortillias with a variety of fillings] and has a store that sells basic grocery items. She learned this business from her mother. Her schedule is from 8:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon. She will use the loan to buy sweets, eggs, flour, cereals, basic grains, soft drinks, etc. so her business will continue to improve. She hopes to offer a variety of products to her customers and continue selling pupusas. An advantage for her is the location of her business, which is in a very busy area.

She hopes to have improved income so she can grow as a business owner and have improved earnings, which she will use to pay her debts and change her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sweets, eggs, flour, cereals, basic grains, soft drinks, etc. so her business will continue to improve.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Fishing has been Jesusa's livelihood for 25 years now. She usually earns 10,000 PHP per month from this business. Jesusa has limited funding for her business at the moment, and that is why she is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat, engine, nylon, fishing nets, fishing weights and floaters. Jesusa hope to change her business for the better after incurring loss due to the typhoon last year.

She is from Carles, Iloilo. She is married with one dependent aged 17. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and live abundantly.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat, engine, nylon, fishing nets, fishing weights and floaters.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is 42 years old and she lives with her sons in the village of Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik region. Elmira’s elder son is now passing his military service at the army and her smallest son is still school-aged. After school he manages to help his lovely mother in farming and agriculture, in which Elmira has been fully engaged already 20 years. In her farm she has a cow, a bull, a calf, four sheep, two lambs and 20 chickens. She says that her day and night work in her cute farm gives her a chance of providing her children with good living conditions. She sells milk, also a great range of dairy products, meat and eggs from her farm. Her plot of land gives her harvests of potato, cucumber and greens, half of which she uses for her family’s needs. Elmira says that with the coming of winter anxieties for her farm cattle care are growing more and more; fodder problems, warmth problems and less farm products during this season; these are the main hardships through which she passes each year.
 
Now she hopes that Kiva lenders will be so kind as to help her to solve such an important question as the purchase of animal fodder for all her farm cattle, for which she asks a loan of 200,000 Armenian drams.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a thirty-six-year-old married man living in Kamwenge Uganda. He deals in farming as his main source of income, which is a business he started to earn a living. He also earns extra income from produce buying and selling. Moses has hopes of constructing a good permanent house however his main challenges are price fluctuations and bad roads that lead to delayed service delivery. 

Moses needs a loan to buy farm inputs like manure and seedlings, and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like manure and seedlings, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Akossouwavi

texts.fr: De nationalité togolaise, AKOSSOUWAVI, demeurant à Lomé au quartier Attiégou est âgée de 42 ans ; elle est mariée et mère de six enfants ; elle vend de l’huile de palme et de la farine de manioc depuis 2003.Au fait, AKOSSOUWAVI achète ses marchandises au marché de la localité de « KOUVE » et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. AKOSSOUWAVI  souhaiterait un appui financier pour plus soutenir son commerce afin de mieux vendre, faire des bénéfices et mieux épargner pour faire face aux diverses charges de son foyers.
texts.en: Akossouwavi is of Togolese nationality and lives in Lomé, in the Attiégou neighborhood. She is 42 years old and is married and the mother of six children. She has been selling palm oil and cassava flour since 2003. Akossouwavi purchases her wares at the local market in Kouve and gets her supplies twice a month. Akossouwavi wants financial support to better sustain her business in order to sell more, make a profit, and save more to meet her household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase five containers of red oil and 125 bowls of cassava flour.

loans.name: Tereso De Jesus

texts.es:
Tereso, ofrece el servicio de estructuras metálicas, su taller inicio a funcionar hace 20 años, aprendió a realizar este oficio con ayuda de sus amigos, actualmente ya tiene mejor equipado su taller, por su experiencia puede realizar trabajos de mucha calidad; Tereso está acompañado y únicamente vive con su pareja, quien tiene una actividad económica diferente, ambos se apoyan mutuamente para salir adelante. 
Será de ayuda para comprar hierro, láminas, tubos, polines, entre otros materiales para cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes, tendrá a su disposición lo necesario para que su negocio siga mejorando, espera cambiar su situación económica.
Sus sueños son seguir diversificando su negocio, cumplir con el pago de sus deudas y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Tereso builds metal furniture items. He started his workshop 20 years ago. He learned this business with the help of friends. His workshop is well equipped. Due to his experience, he can do high-quality work. Tereso lives alone with his partner, who works in a different line of business. They support each other in order to get ahead.

The loan will help him buy steel, metal sheets, tubes, and metal c-beams, among other materials he needs to complete the orders from his clients. He'll have available on-hand what he needs in order to continue improving his business. He hopes to change his economic situation.

His dreams are to continue diversifying his business, pay his debts, and to continue providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy steel, metal sheets, tubes, and metal c-beams, among other materials he needs to complete the orders from his clients.

loans.name: Blema Tesa Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two people who live in the same neighborhood. They are involved in the sale of firewood and underwear. 

Comfort is the representative of the group (the person standing on the right of the photo). She is 48 years old and has not attended school. Comfort has no dependent child and she has been selling underwear for three years. She will use her share of the loan to buy underwear to sell to her customers door-to-door. To bolster her business, Comfort, along with the other group member, is requesting her third loan from ID Ghana.

loans.use: to buy underwear to sell to her customers door-to-door.

loans.name: Lala

texts.en:
Lala is 38 years old and she lives with her family in the village of Zovaber in the Gegharkunik region. Lala has vocational education and the profession of nurse, but she never worked. Farming and agriculture till now are the main activities that she has been engaged in. Lala has a daughter and a son; both of them are students. With the help of her husband Lala takes care of her farm cattle; a cow, seven sheep, three lambs and 20 chickens. Milk, meat and eggs are the main products that, like many farmers, Lala also sells from her farm, and in this way tries to sustain her family's needs. Lala’s husband also does construction work in his village and he works by order.

Lala hopes that this Kiva loan will help her to develop her farming, since with the loan amount she wants to buy a calf, three sheep and also animal fodder for her farm cattle. She really hopes that having a richer farm will reduce her family’s financial problems as well.

loans.use: to buy a calf, three sheep and also animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee husks and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia raises and sells hogs. She is a 37-year-old, married woman and has six children. Her oldest child is 16 and the youngest is five. Together with her family, she lives in Mayorga, Leyte. Aside from hog raising, she does farming. She grows and sells rice. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 15 years.

Lydia has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and pig feed. These tools will help Lydia raise and sell more healthy pigs. In addition to that this will also improve the yield of her farming business.

Lydia would like to expand her business to be successful and also educate her children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.name: Rosalia Leticia

texts.es: Rosalia vive en casa propia con su esposo y se dedica a la venta y elaboración de antojitos como: tostadas de tajaditas de papas, yuca y platanitos vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, por esa razón posee mucha clientela, Rosalia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: yuca, papa, plátanos, aceite, etc. todo por mayor para la elaboración de estos alimentos y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosalia lives in a house that she owns with her husband, and makes a living preparing and selling snacks such as chips made with potatoes, yucca and plantains. Rosalia is a street vendor in the various areas near her home and has many customers. Rosalia is applying for a loan in order to buy basic supplies such as yucca, potatoes, plantains, oil and more in bulk. These items will be used to prepare the foods and to earn higher profits and give her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy yucca, potatoes, plantains, oil and more bulk.

loans.name: Norma Estela

texts.es:
Norma, fortaleció el negocio con la compra de aves de corral que realizo con ayuda del préstamo anterior, sus ganancias han aumentado y las  ha utilizado para cubrir gastos familiares, resarcir su deuda e incluir la crianza de cerdos.
Para norma los créditos le facilitan el capital para fortalecer el negocio, es por esa razón que nuevamente pide ayuda por medio de un financiamiento para invertir en alimento para aves y cerdos, también comprara lácteos, esto le permitirá poder competir en el mercado.
texts.en:
Norma used her previous loan to strengthen her business by buying farmyard birds. Her profits have since increased and Norma has used them to cover household costs, repay her debt and start raising pigs.

For Norma, these loans give her capital to strengthen her business. For this reason she is again applying for a loan in order to invest in feed for birds and pigs, and to buy dairy products; this will allow Norma to be compete on the market.

loans.use: to invest in feed for birds and pigs, and to buy dairy products; this will allow Norma to be compete on the market.

loans.name: Maria Petronila

texts.es:
María, invirtió el préstamo anterior en mejorar el inventario de la venta de panes con pollo, hot dogs, bebidas, etc., teniendo así oportunidad de mantenerse trabajando, su situación  económica actual es más estable, su núcleo familiar es el mismo y mantiene a sus clientes satisfechos.
Considerando que es importante cumplir con las nuevas demandas de sus clientes se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para comprar pan, embutidos, carnes, aderezos, fardos de bebidas, tomates, aceite, etc., tendrá materia prima suficiente para elaborar la venta.
texts.en: María invested her previous loan in improving her inventory for selling bread, chicken, hot dogs, drinks and more. With this opportunity, she was able to continue working and now her financial situation is more stable. María is living with the same family members as before, and is keeping her customers satisfied. As it is important to meet her customers' demands, María has decided to take out another loan to buy bread, cold meats, meat, seasoning, packs of drinks, tomatoes, oil and more; this will give her enough supplies to sell.

loans.use: to buy bread, cold meats, meat, seasoning, packs of drinks, tomatoes, oil and more; this will give her enough supplies to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica desde hace 30 años a la crianza de ganado de engorde, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, Pedro esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de un ternero (ganado)para engorde y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le deja buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Pedro, 59, lives in his own home with his family.  For 30 years he has been raising cattle and selling his products around the area where he lives.  Pedro is requesting a loan to buy a calf to raise so he can continue his work which is very profitable.

loans.use: To buy a calf to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una barbaría ubicada en una zona muy transitada cerca de su casa desde hace 5 años, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de cuchillas y una maquina para cortar pelo y barba ya que esa es única fuente de trabajo y asi podra tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young man's face is blurred because he is 28 years old and lives in a high risk area.  He owns a barber shop in a busy location near his home and has been in business for five years.  He has many customers because of his good work; and he lives in his own home with his family.

The loan he is requesting is to buy razors and a hair and beard clipper.  This is his only source of income, so the investment will give him a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy razors and a hair and beard clipper.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María, se siente agradecía con la institución por el apoyo a través del crédito Kiva que anteriormente se le otorgo, comenta que sus ventas de ropa han mejorado, ofreció mejor variedad de productos, logra cubrir las necesidades familiares y amplio su mercado.
En vista de la próxima temporada de fin de año está preparando su inventario para complacer los gustos de sus clientes, por lo que solicita un nuevo financiamiento para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas, faldas, camisetas, etc., con ello busca mantener su negocio en el mercado.
texts.en:
María is very grateful to the institution for the Kiva loan support she received previously.  She says clothing sales have improved since she began offering a wider variety of products.  This has allowed her to cover her family needs and expand her market.

In view of the upcoming holiday season she is preparing her stock for customer demand and is requesting a new loan to buy pants, blouses, shirts, skirts, t-shirts, etc. to keep her business going.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shirts, skirts, t-shirts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Mabel

texts.es:
Rosa, cuanta con mayor demanda de sus clientes en la venta de tortillas, por lo que se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo préstamo con el que comprara maíz, leña, cal y bolsas para elaborar la venta de tortillas y no dejar de trabajar.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a Rosa a tener materia prima para que su negocio mejorara su productividad, actualmente cuenta con nuevos clientes, los ingresos han mejorado un poco y su familia está muy saludable.
texts.en:
Rosa is noticing an increased demand for tortillas among her customers and is in need of a new loan to buy corn, firewood, lime and bags.  This is so she can continue with her work and tortilla sales.

The previous loan helped Rosa obtain the ingredients needed to improve productivity.  Now she has new customers and her income has increased and the family is healthier.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, lime and bags to sell tortillas and to continue her work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more scrap materials like aluminum, copper, and steel.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha, quiere compartir su satisfacción y agradecimiento con la institución por brindarle apoyo a través del préstamo anterior, pues así ha mantenido la venta de comida en el mercado y una fuente de ingresos más estable para dar mejor vida a sus seres queridos.
Nuevamente requiere de un préstamo para comprar aceite, pollo, granos básicos, bebidas, azúcar, sal, especias y otros ingredientes para elaborar los platillos que ofrece en el negocio, está optimista en seguir trabajando para mejorar cada día más.
texts.en:
Martha wants to share her satisfaction and express her gratitude to the institution for the support she received through the previous loan.  She has maintained her food business in the market, which is a more stable source of income for giving her loved ones a better lifestyle.

Now she is requesting a new loan to buy oil, chicken, basic grains, beverages, sugar, salt, spices and other ingredients to make the food she sells.  She is optimistic about continuing and improving her work day after day.

loans.use: To buy oil, chicken, basic grains, beverages, sugar, salt, spices and other ingredients to make the dishes she sells.

loans.name: Pamela's Group

texts.en:
Pamela's group is formed by 16 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Pamela, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 30 years old, married and has four children. Pamela has been a farmer for eight years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Pamela isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. This year, Pamela will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Pamela's Group will purchase a total of 16 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of seven acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. She now lives alone as her only daughter has married and lives separately with her family. Susanna’s husband still works in the Russian Federation and from there sends money for his family.

As before, Susanna is engaged in farming and agriculture, with the difference being that her farm is richer now. With her farm income, she has managed to make some savings and she has bought more cattle. Now on her farm she takes care of two cows, three heifers, eight sheep, two pigs and 40 chickens. Potato cultivation is her main agricultural occupation and she sells the potatoes to re-sellers from her house. 

Susanna is earning a good profit from her partnership with Kiva, who she greatly thanks, and now wants to take out a second loan. She is getting prepared for the long-lasting winter months. To avoid the problem of not having enough animal fodder, Susanna will use the main part of the loan amount for the purchase of fodder for her farm animals. She will also buy potato seedlings and fertilizer, as the fertilizer is cheaper now than it will be in spring.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her farm animals and also potato seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for their fishing boat such as wood, nails, paints and fishing nets

loans.name: Erik

texts.en:
Erik is a freshman in the American University of Central Asia (AUCA')s Software Engineering Department and this is his story:

I am requesting the loan for my undergraduate studies in the Software Engineering Program. These studies will allow me to be a competent professional in the work market and to find a job that is commensurate with my abilities. Having technical knowledge in this area opens doors to many other opportunities in my career. Also, number crunching and financial analysis are very interesting and challenging for me.

I have a father and a little sister. To help my father, we studied well at school and did not have to pay a dollar for high school. I was good at maths and computing so, in the 10th grade, I decided to be a programmer. Now my goal is to graduate from AUCA, have an internship in Europe, then return and work in Kyrgyzstan. As software engineering is a new sphere in my country, there are not enough good specialists to provide me with more opportunities for self-realization in my motherland. And the Kiva loan will ensure that I will be able to do this.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is 23 years old and lives in Vanadzor, a city in the Lori region. This young lady still lives with her parents and sister. Her father is in architecture, her mother works at the sewing factory as a tailor, and her sister works in a private organization. 

Meri has already worked for three years at the same factory as her mother and she is also a tailor there. She says that she learnt the sewing skills from her mother. She adds that she now works with great pleasure and does her best to become a master like her mother so she can work quickly and accurately at a high level of quality. 

Meri already has a fiancé and recently he made her a proposal of marriage. She says that she is now unbelievably happy and she is sure that their great love will help them to have a nice and warm family.
 
Meri needs this loan because, as she is going to become engaged to her fiancé, her family, with the help of this loan, will organize a nice engagement party for the young couple, a party that will be a happy and colourful start for their life together.

loans.use: to organize a nice engagement party

loans.name: Camelo

texts.en:
Camelo is a 56-year-old married man living in Dulag, Leyte. He operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling merchandise like coffee, noodles, powdered soap, eggs, toothpaste, cooking oil, canned goods and seasonings. He has been operating the store for a year now. Due to very limited amount of capital to sustain his current business, he is seeking ways he could possibly continue his livelihood.
 
Camelo has requested a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy assorted stock like biscuits, beverages, sugar, noodles and soft drinks. 

He is hoping that someday he can expand his livelihood to improve their way of living and to continue supporting the schooling of his child.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock like biscuits, beverages, sugar, noodles and soft drinks.

loans.name: Pardaboy

texts.en:
Pardaboy is 44 years old. He lives in a place which has a wonderful environment with his wife and four children. Their main source of income is from their farm. They own a plot of land where they grow wheat, potatoes and onions. They sell their harvest at the local markets and from these sales, they derive a small monthly income.

For some years, Pardaboy has tried to establish a retail business but he does not have the money and experience to establish a business and to improve  their poor living conditions. Pardaboy discussed this with his wife and decided to develop his business with farming as he has great experiences and skills. As he lives far from town in a village, he has a good opportunity to develop his farming business. 

Pardaboy must buy coal and wood for the winter season. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni with this aim. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy coal and wood for the winter season

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Demeurant à Lomé précisément au quartier Attiégou, AYOKO est âgée de 54 ans, veuve et mère de un enfant, elle fait le commerce des soutien-gorge depuis 2013, qu’elle achète au marché d’Hezdranawè et s’approvisionne une fois par mois. Ayant mesuré la grandeur de la responsabilité qui lui fait face, AYOKO désire un microcrédit pour augmenter son activité génératrice de revenu et alléger les dépenses qui pèsent sur elle, et aussi avoir beaucoup plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Ayoko lives in Lomé, more precisely in the Attiégou district. She is 54 years old, a widow and mother to one child. She has been buying and selling bras since 2013 and gets her supplies once a month from the market in Hezdranawé. Having recognised the significance of the responsibility she is taking on, Ayoko would like a micro-loan so that she can expand her income-generating activity and lighten the burden of her expenses, as well as making significantly more profit.

loans.use: to buy 58 bras.

loans.name: Fredy Alberto

texts.es: Fredy de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 15 años experiencia que le ha dado la oportunidad de vender una buena calidad de producto por esa razón posee clientes fijos, el está solicitando un crédito ya que necesita comprar las herramientas necesarias para continuar con su trabajo como: trasmallos, redes y darle mantenimiento a la lancha que muestra en la fotografía ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y de ingresos.
texts.en:
Fredy is 46 years old and lives in his own house with his family. He has made a living by fishing using traditional methods for the last 15 years. This amount of experience means he can sell good-quality produce which has gained him a regular client base. 

He his requesting a loan because he needs to buy essential tools to continue with his work such as trammel nets and nets. He also needs to carry out maintenance work on the boat shown in the photograph because it's his only source of work and income.

loans.use: to buy trammel nets and other nets and carry out maintenance work on his boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to set up his pizzeria.
